loans.name: Flor De Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PRIMAVERA” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Guillermina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cerveza, venta de repuestos de radio, venta de salchipapas.

La señora Guillermina,  indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cerveza que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cerveza) que adquirirá de las agencias distribuidoras y posteriormente lo venderá en las fiestas zonales en la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda a poyar a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE PRIMAVERA” communal bank will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Alto Lima center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors headed Guillermina. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them we have: selling beer, selling radio parts selling salchipapas.

Guillermina remarks that she has worked with Pro Mujer for two years and she joined the institution at a promotor's invitation. At present, she has a business selling beer and has been doing this for years.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her capital, buying beer from distributors and later selling it at area festivals in the city of La Paz and El Alto. This work helps her support her family. She is in a common law marriage and has 4 children.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Consitance

texts.en: Consitance is 30 years old and a hardworking single mother of one child. She owns a pub which she has been running for 1 year now. She faces a challenge of high transport costs and high labor turnover. Her personal goal is to educate her child and also to build a permanent family house. She dreams of expanding her business to new markets and setting up an executive pub. Consitance needs the loan facility to renovate her residential house.

loans.use: to renovate her residential house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 30-year-old married woman. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Fatuma has operated a dry fish selling business for the past 5 years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. Saturnina has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Saturnina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Faruk

texts.en:
Faruk is 49 years old, and he is living in Iraq with his wife and one child. 

He has a nice little place by a busy road in the city which has been operating more like a little grocery store for the past five years, but recently Faruk introduced an outside grilling oven to his store. Since then he is also able to sell meat, mostly grilled chicken. Meat is rather expensive to buy in his city; however, fried chicken or other poultry is usually part of the typical meal. Because electricity problems make it difficult for individual households to keep meat, baked products are well sought after.

Faruk took a loan from Relief International - Iraq in the amount of $2,700 to continue his store's improvement, and to be able to stock the store with the items he used to sell before the introduction of the grilling oven as well as to continue to produce the baked meat products.

loans.use: to buy more meat for the grilling oven and to restock his store.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie lives in West Point. She is 29 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 9. For the past three years she has been selling gasoline at the local gas station. She received a little amount of money from her husband to start her business, and learned the business from friends. She likes her business because it helps her to send her children to school (pays her children's school fees). She is requesting a loan to purchase more gasoline by the gallon for her business. Amie wishes to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline by the gallon for her business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 51-year-old married woman with 2 children who are grownups. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanasha has operated a dry fish selling business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 47 years old and a single mother of two children, aged 24 and 20. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past ten years with a monthly income of about KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Dinah will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes for resale. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is 33 years old and is married with one daughter who is 12 years old.

Evalyne has a retail shop that she runs in Nakuru town and has had it for the past six years.  She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy baking flour, cooking fat, rice,milk, etc to add to her stock.

She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, cooking fat, rice,milk, etc.

loans.name: `ranjana

texts.en:
Ranjana is 33 years-old.  She is married and has 2 children age 14 and 10 years old.  In 2000, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Ranjana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: To buys grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 30 year old business lady.  She is married to John, who is a business man.  They are blessed with four children.  She has been running a green grocer business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a staff.  Jane will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.  Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and continue with the grocery business.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits for sale in her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in west point.  She is 47 years old.  She is married and her husband is a businessman and they have nine children between the ages of 18 to 32 years old.  For twenty years now she has been operating a cook shop (Restaurant) in her community.  

She received a small amount of money from her husband  to start her business and learned it from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes profits.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more Bonnie fish, spear rid, rice, coal and pig feet for her business.  Her  plan is to build a house for  her children.

loans.use: To purchase more Bonnie fish, spear rid, rice, coal and pig feet for her business.

loans.name: Niangkhou Ndierignou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Nianghou Dierignou" est issu d'une tontine de femmes habitantes du même quartier.Elles exercent le commerce de produits alimentaires notamment des légumes, du poisson ainsi que des denrées de premières nécessité.Elles vendent leurs produits sur des tables installées au petit marché du quartier ou devant leurs domiciles pour certaines.Elles sont toutes mariées et mères de plusieurs enfants. Le chef du groupe ( en boubou noir à droite), vend du poisson frais, fumé et séché ainsi que des légumes. Elle s'approvisionne chaque soir au grand marché de sa localité en denrées périssables qu'elle propose le lendemain de bonne heure à ses clientes.Elle parvient à générer des revenus qui lui permettent d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins alimentaires, vestimentaires et scolaires des membres de sa famille. Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, les femmes sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des légumes, des poissons séchés, des poisson fumé et des produits céréaliers. Leur ambition est d'obtenir une formation en techniques de transformation des fruits et légumes et d'investir ce domaine.
texts.en: The Nianghou Ndierignou group is composed of women from the same neighborhood who have formed a "tontine" (a revolving system whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to the different members). They trade in groceries, notably vegetables, fish and basic food products. The sell their goods on tables that are installed in the small neighborhood market or, in some cases, in front of their houses. They are all married with several children. The leader of the group (dressed in a black "boubou" on the right) sells fresh, smoked and dried fish as well as vegetables. She gets her supplies of perishable food every evening from the large market in her town and sells them early the next day to her customers. She manages to generate sufficient income to help her husband provide for their family's food, clothing, and education. In order to strengthen their businesses, the women are requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy vegetables, dried fish, smoked fish and cereals. Their ambition is to get some training in the technique of preparing dishes from fruit and vegetables and to invest in this field.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, dried fish, smoked fish and cereals

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a 34-year-old married woman with 7 children who attend school.  Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with piped water but no electricity.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Salama has operated a retail shop for the past 2 years; her potential clients are the local area villagers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of detergents, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and sugar for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of detergents, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Rebin

texts.en:
Rebin is a 24 years old married man, living in Iraq with his wife.

For the past 3 years he has been supporting his family by working in his own metal shop, manufacturing metal window and door frames as well as metal doors and gates. 

In the past, Rebin took a loan from Relief International - Iraq to buy a generator for his shop.  After successful repayment of the previous loan, he now took a loan of 2,100 USD to keep improving his store with additional machinery and renewal of his work area.

loans.use: To renew his work area.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.ru:
Гарник  родился в 1960 году в городе Капане. Он окончил Капанский строительный техникум и по специальности он строитель. Гарник женат и у него двое дочерей. Жена Гарника домохозяйка, старшая дочь учится в Капанском Политехническом институте на строительном факультете, а младшая окончила среднюю школу в этом году.  
Ремонтом обуви Гарник занимается на протяжении 20 лет. Гарник имеет собственные станки и обувные формы, а помещение, в котором он занимается бизнесом, Гарник арендует. Раз в месяц он закупает сырье из города Еревана. 
У Гарника всегда много клиентов, так как он делает свою работу качественно и быстро. Гарник работает до позднего вечера, что позволяет клиентам обращаться к нему после окончания их рабочего дня.  
Благодаря своему бизнесу Гарник содержит семью и платит за обучение старшей дочери.
Кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм необходим Гарнику для приобретения обородования (станка для пришивания цепочки к обуви) для своей мастерской, а также для покупки сырья (кожи, подошв и т.д.).
texts.en:
Garnikwas born in 1960 in the city of Kapan. He graduated from the Kapan construction vocational school and is a construction worker by trade. Garnik is married and has two children. Garnik's wife is a homemaker; his older daughter studies in the civil engineering faculty at the Kapan Polytechnical Institute; and his younger daughter finished secondary school this year.

Garnik has been doing shoe repairs for 20 years. Ganik has his own machines and shoe molds, but he leases the shop where he operates his business. Once a month he purchases materials in the city of Erevan.

Garnik always has many clients because he does high-quality and quick work. Garnik works late into the evening, which allows clients to stop by at the end of their work day.

Thanks to his own business Garnik supports his family and pays for the education of his older daughter. Garnik needs a loan of 1,000,000 dram to acquire equipment (a machine for sewing chains to boots) for his workshop, as well as to purchase materials (leather, soles, etc.)

loans.use: To buy equipment and materials for his business

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 31-year-old married man, father of one child. Husein has been working at selling cars' audio hardware, in addition to accessories, for 11 years now. He is an expert in his business, and most of his clients are loyal to him.

Husein loves his business a lot, and he works hard on improving it. He has been an Al Majmoua, Kiva Partner, borrower for two cycles, with an excellent paying-back history.

Today Husein is applying for his third loan cycle, in order to expand his products with new audio releases. His business needs to be updated from time to time to keep his customers pleased.

Husein always aims to expand his business further and to increase his capital, because this will lead to improvement of his living conditions.

loans.use: To expand his products with new releases.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman.  She married, living with her husband.  They both cooperates together to be able to live properly as it should be.  She started to work as a tailor from her home since 2005 and has her second job working as a nurse in a local company.  As for her husband, he has been working as a farmer since 1991. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan of $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew her supplies and buy a new tailoring machine.  She notes that this will help her improve her performance and therefore increase her sales.  In the future, she plans to work on new designs and open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to renew her supplies and buy a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja lives in West Point.  She is 36 years old, is married and has four children between the ages of 11 to 22 years old.  She has been selling lapper in the market.  She received a small amount of money from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother.

She likes her business because she makes a profit.  She is  requesting a loan to purchase more lappers (cloths)  for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children and send them to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers (cloths) for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 35-year-old business lady. She is married to John, who is a business man. They are blessed with one child. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Eunice will use the loan to buy stocks of sugar and rice for her shop. 

The anticipated profit from the business will help her educate her child. Her dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will help improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar and rice for her shop

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 50-year-old married man, father of seven children. Elias is a hardworking man. He used to be a house painter for 26 years and he is still doing it. In addition to his initial business, Elias is specialized in selling and installing receivers and satellites, which he is supporting a lot to reach an important level in such business.

Elias is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new satellites and updated receivers, necessary to keep his business updated. This business is improving these days a lot and he has to keep aware of the new technologies released.

Elias is planning to open a big satellite company in the future, and to expand it all over the region.

loans.use: To buy new satellites and updated receivers.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Lucila; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras como zanahoria,lechuga,tomate entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia vende su mercaderia de forma ambulatoria repartiendolo a sus distintos clientes que le solicitan en los diferentes mercados,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucila alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling vegetables like carrots, lettuce, tomatoes, and others.  She has been in this business for years. Through this business she gets her family ahead.

She sells her merchandise in an itinerant manner.  She distributes it to her different customers who request her vegetables at the different markets.  She is a very happy and responsible person with a great desire to get ahead for her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is a food sales businessman plying his trade in Kyenjojo. The 29-year-old bachelor sells mostly Irish Potatoes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. Week in, week out, his sales returns are to the tune of UGX 40,000.

What is on the horizon for the new year? He says it is the expansion of his business beyond the borders of Kyenjojo. Jonas intends to use his kiva loan to purchase more bags of Irish potatoes to resell

loans.use: to purchase more bags of Irish potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 46-year-old married man and father of six children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a mill (Tahoun) and has been involved in purchasing  grains then selling them to his customers after milling.

He started his business by buying a small mill in his region which ran on diesel. At that time, the customers were attracted more and more because there was not another mill in the region. So he developed his enterprise by purchasing a new mill (Tahoun) running on power and sold the previous mill. He is an incredibly hard-working man and as a result has a lot of experience. In addition, it is the only main source of  his income.

On the other side, through lots of effort he has managed to grind his customer`s grain,  i.e., he provides them a service to put food on the table. Recently, a drought has come for agricultural crops leading to a decrease of customers in his business. So, Ali took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grain for his business.

 In the future, he would like to expand his business to have a grocery store because his region is lacking some services  which he could supply to solve people's needs.

loans.use: to purchase grains for his milling business.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four school-age children. In order to pay her children's educational fees, Fadia and her husband strive to work really hard. And, for that reason, she decided to start her own home business. She opened her own clothing shop in 2003. Her husband has been working also, in a local company for the past fifteen years. Today, she’s looking to borrow $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the new winter collection. She notes that this will increase her business sales especially during the holidays. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase the new winter collection

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 30-year-old married woman with four children who attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanamisi has operated a café for the past two years. Her potential clients are the villagers in the local area. Seasonality is the major challenge she faces. She dreams of establishing a new motorbike transportation business.

With the 50,000 shillings, she wants to purchase a new motorbike for her new motorbike transportation business. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her new motorbike transportation business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 61-year-old business lady; she is married to Peter, a business man. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Margaret will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with five children who attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mejumaa has operated a cereals and fruit-selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more stock of cereals and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cereals and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is the proud owner of "Campesino Restaurant" – a nine-month-old restaurant specializing in Dominican cuisine. Franklin’s motto is simple: homemade food, great customer service and affordable prices! Franklin bought the restaurant using capital from his savings and from personal loans administered by family and friends. 

Franklin needs a loan to improve the environment of his dining area through the purchase of new chairs and tables.  When Franklin’s not busy running "Campesino Restaurant", he takes financing and entrepreneurship classes to better manage and grow his business.

loans.use: to improve his dining area through the purchase of new chairs and tables.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El socio tiene 23  años de edad y es soltero, el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de servicio de taxi,el tiene un carro donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo .El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar repuestos para su carro.

	
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is 23 years old and single.  He continues working at his business, providing a taxi service.  He has a car where he works from 8:00 a.m until 10:00 p.m.  Through this business, he wants to get ahead.  His dream is to have a new car.  He is requesting the loan in order to purchase spare parts for his car.

This member gives thanks to those who form a part of this dream through this medium and he promises to complete his payments according to the establised timetable.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 44-year-old married man and a father of two children. He started selling espresso coffee and hot drinks in early March 2011. He used to work as a taxi driver but his health forced him to stop such a business and turn to a more comfortable one.
The new business is going fine, but needs support to develop more. That's why Youssef has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new, bigger and updated espresso machine capable of meeting his customers' needs.
Youssef is a hardworking man who is trying his best to provide his family with a good and healthy standard of living. He has previously taken two loans from Al Majmoua, which reflected positively on his social life. He hopes this loan will have the same impact.

loans.use: to buy a new, bigger and updated espresso coffee machine.

loans.name: Wasef

texts.en: Wasef is a married 39-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and three children, who are all studying. He’s the one responsible for his family and is seeking to provide them a good future. He has owned a services office since 2006. His job consists of providing housekeepers upon request. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $2,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his office’s interior design. He notes that he will be capable of receiving his customers in a wide and good place. In the future, he plans to open other branches in different areas.

loans.use: to renovate his office’s interior design

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in West Point.  58 years old, she is married with six children between 4 and 26 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past few years now, Martha has been selling rice in the market. She started this with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. In future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 52-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and only one child who is still studying. He collaborates with his wife in order to pay their child’s university costs. His wife teaches in a local school. As for him, he has owned a sweets factory since 1996. In parallel, he has a small mini-market. Today, he wants to borrow $2600 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of raw materials such as sugar, flour and many others. He notes that this will enhance his work and allow him to produce sweets in a bigger quantity. In the future, he plans to open his own pastry shop.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of raw materials such as sugar, flour and many others.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de libros, para esto la socia continua viajando para traer los libros; La socia sigue con su stand y desea seguir prosperando para que posteriormente ella pueda alquilar su espacio y poder aperturar un negocio en casa. La socia desea en esta ocasión invertir el credito en la compra y venta de libros.
texts.en: This member continues with her business of buying and selling books.  For this, she keeps traveling to pick up the books.  She still has her stand and wishes to continue prospering so that later she can rent her space and be able to open a business in her home.  On this occasion, she wants to invest the loan in the purchase and sale of books.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of books.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
El socio sigue trabajando en transporte,el es propietario de una combi que hace servicio publico,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo . El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro como llantas. 
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member continues working in transportation.  He is the owner of a minibus that provides service to the public.  He works from 5:00 a.m until 8:00 p.m.  Through this business, he helps his son get ahead.  His dream is to have a new car.  He requests the loan in order to purchase spare parts for his vehicle, such as tires.

This member gives thanks to those who form a part of this dream through this medium and promises to complete his payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle, such as tires.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 56-year-old business lady. She is married to Francis who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a bakery shop for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Josephine will use the loan to buy wheat flour and sugar.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Taliea

texts.en:
Taliea is a 32-year-old married Iraqi woman who is the mother of two children. She is a proud working woman who helps support her family with contributions from the income she generates from her bakery. In the past, Taliea had worked from home doing minor sewing and tailoring jobs. She applied for and received a previous loan from Relief International - Iraq that she used to purchase a new sewing machine and materials. She successfully repaid her first loan, and then decided to spread her wings a little more and start a bakery. 

For the past two years, Taliea has been successful with her new business, making popular baked good the locals call "tiri," a large bread made of flour and water only (sometimes with a little salt), baked on a surface much like an upside-down wok. The end product is a hard, dry bread which can be kept for months. Before it's eaten it is broken into smaller pieces, moistened, and kept wrapped in a cloth to make sure it doesn't dry out.

Taliea is requesting a 1500 USD loan from RI-Iraq to improve the working space in her bakery.

loans.use: to improve her bakery workspace

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилжон проживает в районе А. Джоми. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает поваром в средней школе. Сам Одилжон занимается скотоводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en:
Odiljon lives in the region A. Jomi. He is married. He has four children. His wife works as a cook at a high school. Odiljon works with livestock. He fattens and sells livestock. 

Odiljon takes a loan for the expansion of his activities.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 47-year-old married man and a father of nine children. He has worked in construction, specializing in cement work, for 32 years. He is a hardworking man responsible for providing for his whole family. His wife takes care of the children and so there is no extra income to help in meeting their household expenses.
Saleh has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy iron pillars necessary for his business. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for one previous loan, and it had a positive effect. He hopes this loan will reflect positively on both the social and financial aspects of his life. Saleh is a  borrower in good standing who works hard to please his customers. He hopes to buy a fishing boat in the future, because he loves fishing and would like to have it as a second business.

loans.use: to buy iron pillars necessary for his business.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a 46-year-old married man. He has owned a grocery store for about two years. Taha's business is developing a little, and he is putting much effort into improving and expanding it as much as he can. In order to do this, Taha is taking his first loan with Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy products that he does not currently stock but are highly requested by his customers. Taha will invest the loan in products such as oils, diapers and some other attractive nutritional goods.
Taha is a man with a good reputation and he is well known in his region. He is seeking perfection in his business, and wants to improve his standard of living. He hopes to expand his business further in the future.

loans.use: to add new products to his shop.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Sabino;El socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servico de transporte urbano el cuenta con su propio carrito con el cual trabaja todos los dias ,siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia,el socio necesita hacer el mantenimiento cada cierto tiempo a su carro para que asi el pueda continuar trabajando,el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

 El  socio solicita el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de su carro como por ejemplo hacer el cambio de aceite.
texts.en:
This member is Sabino.  He alternates his daily tasks by providing an urban transportation service.  He has his own little car with which he works everyday.  Being that in this way he helps his family get ahead, he needs to do routine maintenance every so often on his car, so that he can continue working.  This member is a very happy and responsible person.

He requests the loan to provide maintenance on his car, like for example, changing the oil.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car, like for example, changing the oil.

loans.name: Anan

texts.en:
Anan is a 27-year-old married man, father of one child. He has sold children's gifts and toys for a year. His business is improving, but needs much support. Anan is an enthusiastic man, he puts much effort to prove himself.

Anan is willing to start wholesale trade. Until then, he needs to register his car to be capable of transporting his products from dealers to the shop and vice versa. To do so, he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Most of his customers are villagers, friends, relatives and tourists.  

Anan hopes to reach a good level in his trade and succeed in his living too. He hopes to please his family and reply to their needs as much as he can.

loans.use: to register his car

loans.name: Dismus

texts.en:
Dismus is 33 years old, married to Miriam and has one child. He operates a photocopying and computer services bureau. He also has another secondary business running a beauty shop. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES from his primary business activity.
Dismus is requesting his third loan from Kiva partner KADET of 100,000 KES. He will purchase a photocopier and buy stocks of photocopy paper. With the anticipated profits, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to venture into the real estate business and raise the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new photocopier and printing paper stock.

loans.name: Jerryin

texts.en:
Jarryin is 22 years old and is single with a two-year-old child. She lives in Paynesville. For the past three years, Jarryin has been selling pepper, oil, and vita. She started her business with a small loan received from her friend and she has learned her business from her friends. 

Jarryin is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, and vita for her business. In the future, she hopes to support her family and she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase pepper, oil, and vita to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married with three children. For the past two years, she has been selling fish and cosmetics at Adum Banso.  She uses her income to support her husband and help with the upkeep of their family. 

Ekua is requesting a loan to purchase more fish and cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her expanded business to acquire a cosmetics shop.

loans.use: purchase more and cosmetices to sell

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El. Sr. Oscar Antonio, de oficio zapatero, acompañado, reside en el departamento de Masaya, es dueño de su propio negocio de zapatería desde hace ocho años, en la elaboración de calzado para damas y caballeros, sus ventas las realiza en el mercado oriental ahí cuenta con 12 clientes, Masaya, y una señora que le ofrece los productos en el país de Guatemala y Honduras.
Su núcleo familiar lo componen tres, el cual con el apoyo de su esposa a salido adelante con el negocio.
Se acerca a nuestras oficinas para solicitar nuevo financiamiento y comprar mas materia prima 

Considera que este financiamiento le ayuda a incrementar sus ventas y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familiar.
texts.en:
Oscar Antonio is a shoemaker.  He has a live-in partner, and he lives in the Masaya department.  He has had his own shoemaking business for eight years.  He makes shoes for women and men.  He makes his sales in the Oriental Market, where he has 12 customers in Masaya and a woman who sells the products in Guatemala and Honduras.

There are three people in his family.  With the support of his wife he has gotten ahead in the business.

He came to our offices to request a new loan to buy raw materials.  He feels that this loan will help him increase his sales and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy leather, sponge, style form, riveting, thick yarn, rings, thread, yellow and white glue, fiber, thin lining, balls of yarn, shellac, lacquer thinner, and Guatemalan fabric.

loans.name: Nelly Ludgarda

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio alternativo y aún mas para que se mantenga distraida y relacionada con sus amistades, ella continua con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa de forma independiente y al por menor; la socia tambien reparte sus catalogos de productos de belleza, ella desea seguir trabajando y para ello ella cuenta con una actividad fisica y con un carisma ejemplar, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el creditos en la compra de prendas de damas para la venta.
texts.en: This communal bank member is continuing and even increasing her alternative business so that she can continue to enjoy and stay connected with her friends. She continues her retail business of buying and selling clothing independently. She also distributes her catalogs of beauty products. She wants to continue working, and for that she has physical energy and exemplary charisma. At this time she wants to invest her loan in the purchase of women's clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old married man and a father of one child. He has worked selling fire extinguishers since 2002, and has 13 years of experience in this field. He used to work with his dad in the same area, and has continued on his own.
Ahmad is a hardworking man who is developing his business gradually to achieve his aims. He has taken a step forward by applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy more fire extinguishers to increase his income through selling these extra bottles.
Ahmad hopes to expand his business by moving to a bigger location to increase his extinguishers and income.

loans.use: to buy more fire extinguishers.

loans.name: Zenayda De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Zenayda de Jesús se desempeña como conserje desde hace muchos años en una Institución privada en el municipio de El Sauce de donde es originaria.

Es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales todos los ha formado de la mejor manera posible como personas de bien, trabajadoras, todos son independientes que ayudan a su madre para que tenga un mejor nivel de vida.

Habita con su esposo en su pequeña vivienda la que han construido poco a poco con su propio esfuerzo y gracias a los créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel. Por tal razón en estos momentos está solicitando su séptimo crédito para seguir mejorando su casa y comprar ladrillos, cemento y arena para iniciar a construir un pequeño local para la cocina con el fin de contar con todas la condiciones necesarias para vivir.
texts.en:
The lady Zenayda de Jesús has worked for many years as a superintendent in a private institution in the municipality of El Sauce, where she is from.

She is the mother of five children, all of whom have developed in the best way possible as good, hard-working people.  All of them are independent and help their mother so that she has a better quality of life.

She lives with her husband in their small home that they have constructed little by little with their own efforts and thanks to the loans offered through Ceprodel.  For this reason, right now, she is requesting her seventh loan in order to continue improving her home and to purchase bricks, cement, and sand to start to build a small place for the kitchen with the end of having all of the necessary conditions for living.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Mtazamo Group

texts.en:
Yusuph is in his late twenties and is married with one child.  He has been doing video shooting for four years now.  He works from 7am to 10pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Yusuph’s 14's loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the stock of his business and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to open another business doing money transfer.  Yusuph’s dream is to one day be an international businessman.

Yusuph will share this loan with his loan group, Mtazamo, which totals 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another business doing money transfer.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 23-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of one child. She has been selling cereals for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 30,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Irene will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for her stock.

loans.use: To buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, beans, and maize for sale.

loans.name: Persévérance Plus Group

texts.en:
Rose is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Persévérance Plus” comprised of 15 members firmly united to receive loans from the microfinance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses. She is 35 years old and is married with no children.

Rose’s main business is selling honey and yogurt. She goes door-to-door selling her products east of Kinshasa. Since 2007, Rose has been in the micro-business world and has been working hard with good management skills to realize her dream of one day opening a small honey and yogurt processing and storage plant. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business which currently provides 40 USD each week. Rose works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. Rose is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC and has received and repaid six previous loans.

Rose is requesting a loan to increase her stock of honey and yogurt to re-sell at a profit.

loans.use: to buy honey and yogurt to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Banta

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present Banta, a secondary school teacher in Makeni. He is 53 years old and was born in Kamasondo in northern Sierra Leone. Banta is married and has four children. His wife is a housewife and his children are attending primary and secondary schools.  For the past 14 years, Banta has been a teacher. 

Banta is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en: Ayesha operates a grocery shop, She also sells bags and children's wear at Banso.  She is married to a trader and has two children. Ayesha has been in this business for 15 years now. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe  their children. Her loan will be used to purchase a variety of groceries, clothing and bags for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries, clothing and bags for sale.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda cooks "banku" (fermented maize dough) for sale and she serves it with fried fish, pepper and also tomato sauce with smoked fish at Adum Banso near Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and has four children.  

Linda has done this for six years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accomodation bills. Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her "banku" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to mount a stall for the sale of her cooked "banku" and fish. 

In the picture are a few fishes being smoked before being used for the preparation of the sauce.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her "banku" for sale.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se estaba dedicando al negocio de venta de comida pero no le fue muy bien,pero ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de realizar llamadas telefonicas,ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocios la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda hacer el servicio de llamadas . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares y pagar las lineas de telefonia.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
In the past, this communal bank member has a business selling food, but it didn't go very well. But now she has a business of selling cell phone services (individual calls). She works as a walking vendor from 8 am to 7 pm. Through this business, she wants to raise her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she could supply telephone service. She is applying for the loan to buy cell phones and pay for lines.

She is thankful to those who are part of this dream through the loans, and she promises to make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and pay for lines

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 44 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 21 and 16.  In 2000, she established  her milk selling business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow. 

 In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Osman Y.

texts.en: Presented to you in the photo above is Osman, a secondary school teacher in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Osman is thirty-eight years of age. He is married and has three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools.  Osman has been a teacher for nineteen years now. He has requested this loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to buy iron corrugated zinc sheets, sand, nails, rods, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy iron corrugated zinc sheets, sand, nails, rods, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 46 years old and is a widow with six children between the ages of 10 and 20 years old. Her children are are currently in school and living at home. She lives in Paynesville. For the past 30 years, Julie has been selling pepper and palm oil at the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has a good customer base.

Julie is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper and palm oil for her business. In the future, she plans to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase pepper and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia se seigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,el siembra papa y maiz y tambien ahora esta vendiendo verduras como zanahorias,tomates,pepinos y lechugas,ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tomates,zanahorias y lechugas al por mayor.
              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in the agriculture business, planting potatos and corn, and now she is also selling vegetables like carrots, tomatos, cucumbers, and lettuce.  She sells walking door to door from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  Her dream is to have a place where she could sell the vegetables.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase tomatos, carrots, and lettuce wholesale.

This member is happy about the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase tomatos, carrots, and lettuce wholesale.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
Abu Bakarr is 48 years old and is married with three children, ages 7, 10, and 19. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he is in school and needs assistance. Abu Bakarr established a cosmetic and artificial hair business in 1996. He began his business to avoid being idle and it is his only source of income. Abu Bakarr works seven days a week and nine hours a day to earn about 950,000 SLL every month. 

Abu Bakarr is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy hair extensions and artificial hair products such as Darling and Rihenna. He hopes that his loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to own a house in Freetown, educate his children, and buy a car. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and artificial hair products

loans.name: Rosa Dilia

texts.es:
Rosa Dilia  tiene 38 años  de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de 6,4 y 1 años de edad, los mayores estudian, y vive con su familia  en la colonia pradera de san Pedro Sula, Cortes.          
Rosa trabajaba en una maquila como supervisora de planta, esta experiencia le ayudo a establecer su propio negocio de costura,  donde confecciona, ropa unisex  como camisetas y ofrece servicio de reparación de pantalones para  hombre.  Ella ha sido una persona muy emprendedora que  con su  dedicación ha hecho  crecer favorablemente este negocio, dándole la oportunidad de ampliar mas su taller, convirtiéndolo en una Mini Maquila. 
Ella solicita actualmente un préstamo de 7,000 lempiras, que lo invertirá en compra de repuestos para sus maquinas de costura, para darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus máquinas, para poder  trabajar con la calidad y rapidez sus prendas de vestir,  para que  sus clientes queden satisfechos, y poder generar mayores ingresos  a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Dilia is 38 years old and is married.  She has three children aged 6, 4 and 1, the eldest of which are in school.  She lives with her family in the plains village of San Pedro Sula, in Cortes.

Rosa used to work in a factory as plant supervisor.  This experience helped her to establish her own sewing business, where she makes unisex clothing such as T-shirts and provides repairs for men's trousers.  She has been a very enterprising person, who has been able to grow her business well through her dedication.  This has given her the opportunity to expand her workshop further, converting it into a mini-factory.

She is currently requesting a loan for 7,000 Lempiras, which she will invest in purchasing spare parts for her sewing machines for better machine maintenance.  This will allow her to work with quality and speed to make her clothing items, so that her customers are satisfied and she can generate increased income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her sewing machines.

loans.name: Mirian Susana

texts.es:
Mirian Susana, tiene 63 años de edad, madre soltera con  3 hijas,quienes ya son mayores de edad entre 29 a 33 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Cabañitas de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Mirian, es una persona muy emprendedora  y conocida en la comunidad, ella aprendió a confeccionar ropa con su madre y desde hace 20 años se dedica a realizar esa actividad independientemente, ella confecciona uniformes escolares, de trabajo y costura en general. Le dedica 8 horas diarias para poder cumplir sus responsabilidades.
El préstamo que esta solicitando lo va invertir en compra de telas para la confección de uniformes, ya que es la temporada escolar. Este negocio le ha generado los ingresos para la manutención de sus hijas y gastos del hogar.
Su deseo es seguir trabajando y mantener su record crediticio con la institución.
texts.en:
Mirian Susana is 63 years old.  She is a single mother with three fully-grown daughters aged between 29 and 33.  She lives in the Cabañitas neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Doña Mirian is a very enterprising woman who is well-known in the community.  She learned to sew clothing with her mother, and for the last 20 years she has worked for herself in this business.  She sews school uniforms, work uniforms, and does general tailoring.  She works 8 hours daily to be able to meet her responsibilities.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of fabric for sewing uniforms, as it is the school season.  This business has earned her income for supporting her daughters and her household expenses.

Her desire is to keep on working, and to keep up her credit record with the lending institution.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to sew uniforms and other tailoring.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Katherine from the Georgebrook Central area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 2 months and 12 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. Katherine's husband is a government worker with a low income and the family also has five additional dependents.

For the past seven years, Katherine has been running a bar and restaurant at Georgebrook where she sells food and drinks. She works seven days a week and gets up very early in the morning to prepare food. Katherine also receives income from another business abroad. Her main business challenges are poor electricity supply and insufficient capital. 

Katherine is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks and bags of rice. The extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Katherine plans to build a hotel. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and bags of rice

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 12 and 20 who are currently in school and living at home. She lives in Paynesville and her husband is a driver. For the past 30 years, Martha has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a good profit and has a solid customer base since her business is in a very good location. 

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Antonia; La socia altera sus actividades diarias dedicandose a la agricultura ella siembra lo que son papa y  maiz,la socia lleva años ejerciendo este su negocio ya que la socia vende sus productos a sus clientes que le solicitan en los diferetes mercados de Cusco pero a la vez sus mismos clientes la visitan en su casa para comprar sus productos ,la socia es una persona bien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su chacra.
texts.en:
The member's name is Antonia. She alternates her daily activities with farming. She grows potatoes and corn. She has been in this business for years. Antonia sells her products to her customers who request them in different Cusco markets. At the same time, customers visit her at her house to purchase her products. She is a responsible person with a great desire to make progress for her family. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizers for her small farm.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizers for her small farm.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Como padre de familia responsable de dos hijos, el señor Pedro Antonio está en el deber de apoyarles en sus estudios para que estos se desarrollen, sean grandes profesionales y personas de bien al igual que él y su esposa. Es originario del municipio de El Sauce, donde ha vivido toda su vida, se desempeña como obrero en una institución del Estado desde hace muchos años.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y su trabajo ha logrado darles lo mejor que puede a su familia, mejorando su vivienda para que tengan mejores condiciones de vida, educando a sus hijos de la mejor manera y todo esto también con el apoyo de Ceprodel, ya que le ha brindado la confianza de otorgarle tres créditos para construcción de su vivienda.

Una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un financiamiento para la compra de útiles escolares, uniformes y zapatos para sus dos hijos debido a que se acerca el año escolar y debe velar para que sus pequeños se preparen y así continuar contribuyendo a su desarrollo. Por esta causa está en espera del crédito para proceder con el apoyo escolar a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
As the father of a family who is responsible for two children, Sr. Pedro Antonio has the duty to support them in their studies so that they develop, become professionals, and become good people like him and his wife. He is originally from the town of El Sauce, where he has lived all his life. He has been a worker at a government institution for many years.

Thanks to his efforts and his work, he has succeeded in giving the best he could to his family, improving their house so that they had better living conditions, educating his children in the best way, and all this was also with the support of Ceprodel, since it had the confidence in him to grant him three loans for the construction of his house.

One of his present needs is to acquire some financing for the purchase of school supplies, uniforms, and shoes for his two children, because the school year is approaching and he needs make sure that his little ones are prepared and thus continue contributing to their development. For this cause, he is hoping for the loan to proceed with the school support of his little ones.

loans.use: o buy school supplies, uniforms, and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 28-year-old Fatmata from Kissy, in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Lone. She is single with a six-year-old child who attends school. Fatmata also takes care of three relatives. For the past 10 years, she has run a store where she sells soft drinks, milk, sugar, biscuits, and cocoa. Fatmata works seven days a week and her business is her sole source of income. Her main business challenges are inflation and sales that are sometimes slow. 

Fatmata is requesting a loan to buy provisions such as soft drinks, milk, sugar, cocoa, and biscuits. She will use the extra income from her loan to improve her business and increase her savings. In the future, she plans to become a bigger supplier. Fatmata thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, sugar, cocoa, and biscuits

loans.name: Diana Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Diana tiene 29 años, esta casada, reside en la comunidad de La Reina en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula.
Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatos nuevos para damas, caballeros y niños. Inicio esta actividad  motivada por la necesidad de apoyar económicamente a su madre y su hogar.
Ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 18,000 Lempiras para capital de trabajo, el que piensa invertir en la compra de otros estilos de zapatos y surtir su negocio.
Diana está muy agradecida por la confianza  que la institución le tiene al brindarle este préstamo, a la ves  motivada a mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Diana is 29 years old and married.  She lives in the La Reina community in the San Pedro Sula municipality.

She sells new shoes for women, men, and children.  She was motivated to start this business activity by the need to financially support her mother and her household.

She has requested a loan for 18,000 lempiras for working capital.  She plans on buying other styles of shoes and to stock her business.

Diana is very grateful for the trust that the institution has shown by providing this loan.  She is motivated to improve her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy shoes and tennis shoes.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El socio Mario; continua con su trabajo independiente y esta al volante de su unidad vehicular y continua prestando el servico de taxi; el socio sigue adelante apoyando en los estudios de sus hijos y en todo lo referente al hogar y vivienda, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en el mantenimiento de sus unidad vehicular.
texts.en:
Mario continues to work independently.  He is at the wheel of his vehicle as he continues to provide taxi service.  He continues to support his children’s education and everything having to do with the household and the house.

At this time he wishes to use the loan for maintenance on his taxi.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Isata.  She is married, and has two children aged five and eight years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because they want to learn her trade.  

In 2002, Isata established her ready-made clothing business. She began her business because it is profitable and that is her only source of income. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Isata would like a loan of Le 3,000,000.  Isata requires a loan in order to buy cotton material, bed spreads and types of clothing materials. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Isata plans to increase her business, educate her children and to get a house.   She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cotton material, bed spreads and types of clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Isata from Georgebrook central area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 6 months and 5 years. Two of her children are currently attending nursery school. 

In 2002, Isata established her water purifying business. She began her business because she thinks that a lot of citizens are suffering and want to drink pure water. She says that the main challenges to her business are waste of plastic and insufficient electricity power supply. She has 10 employees working for her. Her other source of income comes from sales from a small provision store. 

Isata requires a loan in order to buy more materials to purify the water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to send her children to school for better education. In the future, Isata plans to open a bigger water company. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more materials to purify the water

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in Paynesville. She is 44 years old and married with three children, between 5 and 19 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past 4 years, Evelyn has been selling palm oil in the market. She started this business with a small amount received from her husband. Evelyn says she enjoys her customers and the money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien la socia tiene un salon de belleza donde relaiza cortes de cabello,ondulaciones y teñidos y tambien vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de salon de belleza y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tijeras,ruleros y tintes y tambien para comprar productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.  

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to devote herself to the grocery store business and she also has a beauty salon where she cuts and colors hair and gives perms, and also sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk and crackers. By means of these small businesses the member is getting her children ahead. 

The member's dream is to expand the beauty salon and grocery store businesses. She is seeking the loan to purchase scissors, curlers and hair dyes and also to purchase products for the grocery store such as wholesale rice, sugar, milk and oil. She is happy to receive the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, curlers and hair dyes as well as products for setting up the grocery store such as wholesale rice, sugar, milk and oil.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isatu. She is married and has 2 children, ages 13 and 9 years. In 2006, Isatu established her groundnut and beans business. She began her business because she wants to actualize her dream of independence and that is her only source of income. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 950,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy groundnut and beans. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 270,000 SLL. 

In the future, Isatu plans to seek more funds to expand her business, give her children a quality education and own a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groundnut and beans

loans.name: Agenes

texts.en: Agnes operates a grocery shop at Adum Banso. She also makes palm kernel oil for sale, which she has been doing for 10 years now. The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, tin milk, tin tomatoes, and powdered milk. She is married to a small-scale miner. Agnes uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell and also to purchase more palm fruit for the preparation of the palm kernel oil to sell. With the new profit, Agnes plans to expand her grocery shop.

loans.use: purchase a variety of grocery items to sell and also purchase more palm fruit for the preparation of the palm kernel oil to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a hairdresser and sells plastic containers and cosmetics at Adum Banso. She is married and has 2 children. Hannah has been selling plastic containers and cosmetics for 5 years. She supports her husband in the upkeep of the family. Hannah will use her loan to purchase more plastic containers and cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to acquire a shop for the sale of the cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic containers and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for jeans, T-shirts, and boots for his business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man who opened three years ago an international calls services office. This type of business is highly requested in some areas, since most of those who live in it are foreigners or poor people who can't afford to buy a mobile or handle huge phone bills.

Mohamad is working hard to improve his business. He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to expand his business through renting another shop directly next to his present shop to sell in it mobiles and prepaid mobile cards and accessories, since it is a good income business.

Mohamad aims to keep on expanding his business more and more and to make a small happy family in the future since he just took his first step towards engagement.

Mohamad is willing to work hard.

loans.use: To expand his business by renting another shop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells cooking utensils, cloth, and materials at Adum Benso. Cecilia is married to a farmer and has two children. Cecilia has been doing this for some time now. She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 24 years old and single. He has been operating a retail shop for the last seven years with a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes).

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD for Kes 60,000 to buy more stock of wheat flour, juices and sugar for his shop. With the anticipated profits, he will buy a motorcycle for transporting stock for his shop.

His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale store in his locality.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business.

loans.name: Carlos Gerald

texts.es:
Carlos Gerald es un joven muy dedicado a su familia, trabajador que se dedica desde hace muchos años a laborar como docente de primaria y quien está comprometido con su municipio por enseñar buenos valores a los niños.

Como padre abnegado está haciendo lo posible por mejorar la salud de su niño para que se desarrolle sanamente ya que ha estado afectado de salud y requiere la compra de los medicamentos y pago de consultas médicas para su mejoría. Por esto solicitó un crédito a Ceprodel para la compra de medicina, pago de consultas y pago de exámenes médicos.

Espera confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así lo invertirá en la salud de su hijo que tanto lo requiere.
texts.en:
Carlos Gerald is a hardworking young man, devoted to his family, who has worked for many years as an elementary school teacher and who is committed within his municipality to teaching good values to the children. 

As a self-sacrificing father he is doing everything possible to improve his son's health so that he may grow up healthy since his son has had some health problems and requires the purchase of medicines and medical care in order to get better. Thus he has requested a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase medicines and to pay for medical exams and treatment. 

He trusts that his request for a loan will be satisfied and so he will invest it in the health of his son who is so much in need.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and medical care for his son.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia  is 56 years old and lives in Sinkor.  She is married and has eight children between 8 and 37 years old. For the past eight years Julia has been selling  alcoholic drinks. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. Julia is requesting a loan to purchase more  alcoholic drinks for her business. Her plan is to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more  alcoholic drinks for her business

loans.name: Salkyngul

texts.ru:
Салкынгул 46 лет, замужем, воспитывает пятерых детей. Основная деятельность  семьи Салкынгул – животноводство и полеводство.  В 2005 году, Салкынгул решила заняться и откормом и перепродажей скота, вложив в первоначальный закуп скотины 5,000 сом (KGS). 
На сегодняшний день,  хозяйство Салкынгул, насчитывающее десять овец, одного бычка и одну лошадь, приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 8,000 сом. Доходы от бизнес - деятельности Салкынгул позволяют оплачивать  образование ее старшему сыну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салкынгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Салкынгул планирует направить на реконструкцию своего дома.
texts.en: Salkyngul is 46 years old, married and is raising five children.  Her family's primary business is animal husbandry and farming.  In 2005, Salkyngul decided to get involved in fattening up and reselling livestock, having invested an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock.  Today, her business contains ten sheep, one bull and one horse, and yields a monthly income of 8,000 som.  The profits from her business allow Salkyngul to pay for her oldest son's education.  In order to further develop her business, Salkyngul requested a loan in the sum of 110,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep.  She plans to direct the profits from the loan to the remodeling of her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ulmas

texts.ru: Улмас проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 51 год. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Она берет кредит для покупки муки, масла, яиц, шоколада и конфет.
texts.en: Ulmas lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 51 years old.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells food products.  Ulmas is requesting this loan to purchase flour, butter, eggs, chocolate and candy

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, eggs, chocolate and candy

loans.name: Haydar

texts.ru: Хайдар житель города Исфара. Он предоставляет услугу. В основном он развозит пассажиров по маршруту №9. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Haydar is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He provides a service.  He primarily transports passengers along the number 9 route.  Haydar has been involved in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Khursandmurod

texts.ru: Хурсандмурод проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него один сын. Его жена домохозяйка, а сын работает таксистом. Сам Хурсандмурод занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном занимается торговлей мужской одежды и обуви. Кредит берет для покупки осеней обуви.
texts.en: Khursandmurod lives in the Gissar district.  He is 48 years old, married and has one son.  His wife is a homemaker, and son works as a taxi driver.  Khursandmurod is involved in sales at a market.  He primarily sells men's clothing and shoes.  He is requesting this loan to purchase autumn shoes.

loans.use: to purchase autumn shoes

loans.name: Fayzali

texts.ru: Файзали житель района Хуросон. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Он имеет высшее образование. Файзали более 25 лет работает инженером.  Также он занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Fayzali is a resident of the Khuroson district.  He is 54 years old, married and has seven children.  He has a higher education.  Fayzali has been working as an engineer for over 25 years.  He is also involved in animal husbandry and has been in this business for 20 years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase several heads of cattle

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается животноводством. В основном он откармливает и продает скот.
