loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” tiene 16 integrantes todas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Este comité es nuevo aun dentro del programa de la fundación paraguaya. Ahora pasaron al 2do ciclo y sus pagos tantos como ellas son muy puntuales   y hoy en día son mujeres muy trabajadoras, activas y responsables.
Olga es una mujer muy emprendedora y dice que hace unos años empezó con una péquela tienda de bebidas y que gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido crecer y de esa for4ma convertirse en toda una microempresaria. Su meta es seguir trabajando y crecer, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a sus familiares.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas,  demás tipos de bebidas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener en stock esos productos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Tenacious Women) communal bank has 16 members, and they are all friends and neighbors in the city of Villa Elisa.  This bank is new to the program with the Fundación Paraguaya.  They are now ending their second cycle.  Their payments are very punctual just like they are.  Today they are very hard-working, active, and responsible women.

Olga is a very enterprising woman.  She says that she started a small drink store years ago.  Thanks to her effort and sacrifice her business has been able to grow.  This way she has become a complete small businesswoman.  Her goal is to keep working and growing.  She will do this so that she will be able to continue helping her family members.

She is requesting the loan to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, and other types of drinks.  This way she will be able to buy drinks and have these products in stock.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, and other types of drinks.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité Sagrada Familia  se formó con la unión de 17 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  pero también actividades como grupo, con lo que buscan fortalecerse como grupo.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de hacer todo tipo de labores juntas.
La Señora Luisa es una de las integrantes del comité, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica  a la peluquería. Es peluquera a domicilio, es decir, ella se acerca hasta la casa de las clientas que la llaman para poder trabajar. De esa forma se ha hecho muy conocida y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela. Su sueño es poder tener un local en su propia casa, para que no tenga que dejar mucho tiempo su casa.
Ella pide la ayuda de kiva y fundación paraguaya, para la compra de shampoo, gel, enjuagues, esmalte para uñas, peines, ruleros y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Sagrada Familia” (Sacred Family) communal bank was formed by the union of 17 neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All of the members carry on independent business activities.  They also have business activities as a group, which they do to strengthen themselves as a group.  The members formed a very united group that is capable of doing all types of work together.

Luisa is one of the members of the communal bank.  She is married and has one child.  She devotes herself to hairdressing.  She is a home hairdresser, which means that she goes to the customer’s house to be able to work when they call her.  She has become very well-known this way.  She now has a very good clientele.  Her dream is to be able to have a place in her own house.  That way she would not have to spend a lot of time away from her house.

She is asking Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for help to buy shampoo, gel, rinses, nail polish, combs, rollers, and other supplies to be able to keep working and meeting her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, gel, rinses, nail polish, combs, rollers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María, vive junto a su esposo y sus seis hijos en casa propia, ella junto a sus hijos se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos frijoles y maíz además en casa tiene crianza de cerdos, el oficio lo aprendieron de sus padres no tienen un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo necesitan para comprar concentrado para los cerdos y para insumos agrícolas como: herbicidas, semilla y abono, de esa forma obtendra lo necesario para la granja y la siembre, apoyandose de la familia al tener lo necesario para sus negocios.
El sueño de María  es siempre seguir trabajando y obtener mejores cosechas en este año y que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en: María lives with her husband and 6 children in her own home, and she and her family farm staple crops such as beans and corn.  They also care for pigs.  They learned these trades from their parents and work around the clock.  They seek this loan to buy feed for pigs and other agricultural items such as herbicide, seed and fertilizer.  In this way, they can increase production and cover the household's needs and expenses.  Maria dreams of working hard to obtain better crop harvests this year, to better provide for her family

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Rosa Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Rosa Poty se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas y cría de animal. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto y desean poder seguir dentro del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
María es una de la integrantes y nos cuenta que tiene una carnicería, donde vende todo tipo de cortes de carnes, de primera y más económicas. Este trabajo es el que le ha dado la oportunidad de mantener su hogar y ayudar a su familia. Comenta que hoy en día es muy difícil mantener un negocio porque hay mucha competencia, pero que pese a ello no se desanima y sigue luchando.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de carnes de todo tipo, con lo que podrá abastecer su negocio y poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Rosa Poty committee was formed by several neighbors in the city Santaní. All members maintain independent activities, such as sales or animal husbandry. The members have formed a very close-knit group capable of communal activities to benefit all of them. They are eager workers that wish to continue in the program of women entrepreneurs of the Paraguayan foundation.
María is one member who runs a butcher shop, selling all kinds of meat, from prime cuts to lesser quality cuts.  This job allows her to sustain her home and help her family.  She notes that growing competition makes it hard to maintain a business, but she continues working undiscouraged.
She seeks this loan to buy all kinds of cuts of meat to stock her butcher shop, to serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat for re-sale

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is thirty-nine years of age and is married with three children.

Vera owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Vera needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Vera joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Vera's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal is married and has five children. She is 48 years old and resides at Liposong, Ozamiz City, Philippines. 

Rosal owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In 2007, Rosal joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. 

In the future, Rosal wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Medalla Milagrosa ” están  en el Séptimo Ciclo  con 18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  las mismas cuentan con actividades  diferentes, y realizan labores para la recaudación de fondos para el comité.
Celina se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, sea para hombres, mujeres y niños, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Nos comenta que desde siempre ha trabajado  y por ello no teme a los desafíos. Se define como una persona muy sacrificada y por sobre todo honesta, quien lucha por dar a su familia todo lo mejor día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, pantalones, camisas y demás, con lo que podrá estar bien surtida para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Medalla Milagrosa ” committe is in its seventh cycle and has 18  members.  It is an outstanding and very close-knit group, known in the area for showing solidarity and for being responsible.  Members are engaged in various activities and work to collect funds for the committee.
Celina sells all kinds of clothing for men, women and children, and is a very hard-working woman. She says that she has always worked and does not fear adversity.  She considers herself honest .and self-sacrificing, and works hard to provide for her family's day to day needs.  She seeks this loan to buy a varied stock of clothing, such as shirts, pants, t-shirts and others, to provide a better variety of items for her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is from Liposong, Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old. Sarah is married and has four children. To make a living, Sarah plants, harvests and sells bananas. Sarah has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Sarah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pesticides and pay for banana planting. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and pay for banana planting.

loans.name: Tsoggerel

texts.en: Now he wants to make an adjustment to his car for routine maintenance. It will be good for his job performance. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to getting an adjustment to his car.

loans.use: To get an adjustment to his car.

loans.name: Lizet Margarita

texts.es:
Lizet es una joven de 23 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Mala, ubicada al sur de nuestra capital, se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también por su actividad principal que es la agricultura; Lizet está casada y junto a su esposo tienen 2 pequeños cuyas edades comprenden entre 1 y 5 años, el mayor ya va a la escuela y cursa el educación inicial, Lizet, su esposo trabaja en una universidad cuidando la plata de crianza de Tilapias. Lizet como buena peruana ama nuestra comida y su plato favorito es el “Chupe de camarones”; ella estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos suficientes , pero le hubiera gustado estudiar costura.

Lizet se dedica a la venta de abarrotes,dulces, helados y bebidas, ella trabaja desde muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes; trabaja alrededor de 12 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al dia,, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende de manera amable y sobre todo les brinda una sonrisa a sus clientes.

Lizet agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá ampliar su negocio comprando , con esta mejora ella podra tener mas variedad de productos y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida y tendra mas ingresos para seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:”Terminar de Construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Lizet is a 23-year-old young woman who lives in the city of Mala, located south of our capital. It is known for its warm climate and also, for its principal activity, agriculture.  Lizet is married and together with her husband, has 2 small ones whose ages are between 1 and 5 years of age. The older child already attends primary school. Lizet and her husband work in a local university caring for tilapia. Lizet,like a good Peruvian, loves our food and her favorite plate is “Chupe de camarones" (a local shrimp dish). She studied only up to the 5th year of secondary school, since her parents  lacked sufficient economic resources, but she would have liked to study dress-making. 

Lizet sells groceries, mainly sweets, ice cream, and drinks. She works from early morning, hoping to offer her products to customers. She works around 12 hours daily, and some 15 customers per day visit her shop. She believes her business is going well, because she runs her shop in a kindly manner and, above all, she offers her clients a smile. 

Lizet is grateful to the Kiva investors, since the help they have offered made it possible to expand her business by buying more merchandise. With this help, she was able to buy a greater variety of products and, thus, improve her quality of life, earning more income and saving more towards her grand dream: “to finish building her house.”

loans.use: buy merchandise, mainly groceries, for her store.

loans.name: Victor Michael

texts.en:
As quoted by Napoleon Hill, ” if you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way".  Mr. Victor Michael has the strong determination to achieve his desire. He is married, resides at Baybay Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental and is blessed with two children of school age.

Mr. Victor Michael is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He borrowed money in Paglaum MPC for the purpose of making a down payment om a motorcycle. 

Therefore, Mr. Victor Michael has the best way to predict the future: to create it.

loans.use: to pay the down payment for a motorcycle

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Leiua

texts.en:
Leiua is 48 years of age and married with eight children.

Leiua owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Leiua needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2011, Leiua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leiua's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is from Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old. Joel is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Joel raises livestock, primarily pigs, to sell. Joel has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2004, Joel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He is requesting a new loan of 42,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Seiloga

texts.en:
Seiloga is fifty-three years of age and is married with seven children.

Seiloga owns & operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Seiloga needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Seiloga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Seiloga's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Oyunbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunbayar, 32, works as a conductor of the public bus. She has been doing this job for many years and lives with her family in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband Bor runs a taxi around the districts of city and has had many permanent customers. The main income of this family consists of her or her husband’s business earnings. Lately, her husband’s taxi car has become bad and it's core parts are damaged. A month ago, his car's gear box broke and he still cannot not renew it. Due to this, his business has been stopped for over a month. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the necessary spare-parts for his broken taxi car.

loans.use: To purchase spare-parts for her husband's broken taxi car.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is seventy-three years of age and is a widow with eight children.

Pepe owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business.    Pepe needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Pepe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pepe's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Aness

texts.en:
Aness started her business because of her passion for helping people. It is that same passion that has helped her grow her business from one customer a day to thirty a day. She believes that her mobile money business is vital for her community, which is just learning about the new technology of sending money using cellular phones. 

Her proudest moment so far when it comes to her business is getting her very first customer who she had to convince to send money using her service; she had to educate the person and will never forget the feeling she got when that one customer was able to use her service, fully understand it, and come back for more transactions. To Aness, educating people about mobile money is just as important as the transactions. 

At 25, Aness is expecting her first child; she lives in a small border town with her long-time boyfriend. She faces many challenges like living in an area that is very far from where her shop is located, but the biggest one of all is that her working capital is not enough to satisfy her ever growing customer base and does not give her enough profits. As such she is forced to constantly be moving to and from the bank to convert her cash to electronic and vice versa. When Aness gets her loan she wants to increase her working capital and get some chairs for her booth so that her customers can be comfortable and she can better educate them about mobile money. 

In her picture, Aness is standing by her booth which she uses to serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy some new chairs and move to a new place that is nearer to her shop

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a 30 year old divorced mother of two. She runs her own store as a Champion Agent for Mobile Transactions in Solwezi providing money transfer services to her community. She started her business in July 2011 because she has always wanted to have a business of her own and when the opportunity came through Mobile Transactions, she took it. Within a month of starting her business Angela was already doing more than 1000 money transfers a month. 

Access to financial services in Zambia is both scarce and expensive. Close to 10 million Zambians, 80% of the population, do not have bank accounts. As most Zambians live in rural areas, distance and transportation factors hinder access to available financial services. Mobile Transactions Zambia Limited (MTZL) is an early stage company that specializes in low-cost mobile money and other financial transaction service by propagating an open network using small businesses called Champion Agents. Angela is a Champion Agent. This is her story. 

Angela believes her community benefits from her business in a very positive way because the service she provides is faster compared to other money transfer services and more often has enough cash to pay out receiving customers. She currently has one employee and two teller windows, which she uses to serve her customers. 

When Angela receives her loan she will be able to increase her float money (electronic and cash value of her working capital) which will enable her to satisfy more customers. She also wants to use the loan money to pay for her booth which she is currently using to serve her customers. Angela is hopeful that once she has increased her float money she will be able to earn more commissions and have enough money to have her children, who are currently living with her parents in Lusaka province 12 hours away, come live with her. 

In the video, a representative of MTZL interviews Angela.

loans.use: To pay for her booth and increase her electronic and cash working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his working capital so that he can earn more commisions

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 54 años de edad es un hombre casado que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y  tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 24 a 27 años. Es también el propietario de una tienda,  mediante la cual vende productos de primera necesidad al detalle, como ranchos, víveres enlatados, embutidos etc. negocio con el que ha logrado el sostenimiento de su familia. Su idea emprendedora empezó hace muchos años, cuando se dedicaba a la venta de frutas en un pequeño puesto en el mercado de la ciudad. Allí tuvo un accidente pues un burro le mordió la cara y como no podía continuar asoleándose, se ideó el vender productos de la canasta familiar, desde su propia casa a los vecinos; con este negocio le ha ido muy bien, pero sus expectativas de crecimiento, son superiores a su capital de trabajo por eso inyecta a su negocio, dinero de crédito y ha recibido de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo3 financiamientos; con esta organización tiene 4 años  de estar vinculado y  ha ido creciendo gradualmente; hoy está solicitando un credikiva, para comprar en mayor cantidad, víveres, licores y refrescos como cerveza, para surtir su negocio con mercancías, que son las que mas rotan en las épocas navideñas y de año nuevo. Esta es justamente su razón para aplicar un crédito a su negocio pues la probabilidad de éxito es alta y así mismo de su crecimiento como empresario de la microempresa.
texts.en: Carlos is 54 years old. He is married, he lives in the town of Cartagena and has 4 children aged between 24 and 27 years of age. He is a retailer and he also owns a shop where he sells basic necessities such as snacks, canned food, sausages and so on. Thanks to this activity he has succeeded in providing for his family. He came up with his entrepreneurial many years ago, while he was engaged in selling fruits in a small stall located in the town’s market and he suffered an accident: a donkey bit him in the face, and as he could not keep on working standing in the sun, he decided to sell basic necessities to his neighbors from his own house. This activity has been going very well but his expectations of growth are higher that his working capital can allow him: for this reason he invests money from the loans in his activity, having already received 3 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He has been working for 4 years with this organization, gradually growing as well. He is now requesting a loan to buy large quantities of food, liquors and drinks such as beer to stock up his shop with the products he gets more requests for in the Christmas and New Year seasons. This is precisely his reason for asking for a loan for his shop, due to the high success rate of his activity, as well as those of growing as a micro entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of food, liquors and drinks to stock up his shop.

loans.name: Paul Dario

texts.es: Paul de 22 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 1 a 7 años, allí tiene un negocio donde vende gafas y accesorios formulados y de lujo, estuches fantasías, artículos de plata y accesorios en oro golfi. Negocio que aprendió de su padre cuando al morir en el año 2001 , Paul se encargó del negocio que este dejó y en el año 2009 se ubicó en un corredor comercial importante del estadio de futbol profesional de Barranquilla, de donde fue reubicado e instalado en un local comercial, destinado para que vendedores ambulantes ocupen sin obstruir el espacio público.  Sus principales clientes son peatones, habitantes de la ciudadela del barrio, turistas, aficionados a los partidos de futbol, entre otros, a ellos les vende de contado aunque tiene también una cartera con créditos.  Su interés de crecimiento empresarial es evidente y es por esto que en la actualidad, está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado, gafas y accesorios de lujo, estuches,  fantasías, artículos de plata y accesorios en oro golfi, para tener surtido su negocio en la época  de mayor disponibilidad de dinero que tienen sus clientes Navidad y fin de año y hacer de esta inversión todo un éxito..
texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old.  He lives with his common law wife and their 3 children ages 1 to 7.  

He has a business selling glasses, standard and luxury accessories, jewelry cases, silver and gold plated accessories. He learned this business from his father.  When his father died in 2001, Paul took over the business that his father left him.  In 2009 he moved to an busy commercial area near the professional soccer stadium in Barranquilla.  From there, he was relocated and moved to a shopping area set up for street merchants to use without obstructing public spaces.  His main customers are pedestrians, people who live in the neighborhood, tourists, soccer fans, etc.  He makes sales in cash although he can also take credit.  

His interest in growing his business is clear, and for this reason he is applying for a Kiva loan.  This is his first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to purchase a greater than usual amount of glasses, luxury accessories, cases, costume jewelry, and silver and gold plated accessories so that his business is well stocked during Christmas and New Year’s, when his customers tend to have more money available. He plans to make this investment a success.

loans.use: to purchase larger than usual quantities of glasses, luxury accessories, cases, costume jewelry, silver and gold plated accessories.

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposo desde hace diez años junto con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos: pescado, conchas, curiles y camarón, el negocio lo inicio hace seis años con su esposo, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más marisco como: conchas,camarones y pescado, de esa manera tendrá una mejor oportunidad de vender más variedad y podrá darles lo que necesitan su familia.
El objetivo de Santos crecer en clientes y siempre mantener su negocio con variedad, obtener mejores ganancias cada día y poder darles siempre lo que necesitan su familia.
texts.en:
Santos has been living with her husband for 10 years. They have three children. She sells seafood: fish, scallops, shrimp. She started the business six years ago with her husband and does not have a set schedule.

Santos will use the loan to buy more seafood such as scallops, shrimp and fish. In this way she will have more opportunity to sell a greater variety of seafood and will be able to meet her family’s needs.

Santos’ goal is to expand her customer base and to always offer a range of seafood in her business so that she will earn more daily income and always be able to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fish, scallops and shrimp.

loans.name: Marcela Maribel

texts.es:
Marcela, se dedica a la venta de merienda, vive con su tía, la casa es familiar, ella está soltera no tiene hijos, desde hace un año está vendiendo meriendas y realiza las ventas en la casa.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de meriendas, como maíz, aceite, condimentos, azúcar, sal, carnes, pollo, para poder darle continuidad a la producción.
Con este préstamo espera tener el negocio estable, que le siga generando lo más necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela sells snacks. She lives with her aunt in the family home. She is single and does not have children. She has been selling snacks for a year and makes sales in the house.

Currently she is requeting a loan to purchase the basic material to make snacks such as corn, cooking oil, condiments, sugar, salt, beef and chicken so that she can continue production.

With this loan she hopes to provide stability to her business, which continues generating a needed income for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, condiments, sugar, salt, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Eunice Del Socorro

texts.es: Eunice  está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, pues está satisfecha con lo que obtuvo en su anterior financiamiento, mediante el cual compró mercancía variada, productos alimenticios y hasta calzado, todo esto lo vendió y aumentó su utilidad. En la actualidad, aprovechará la época de Diciembre, que es el mejor mes del año para vender la mercancía que ella ofrece y en esta temporada alta ella aumentará mucho mas sus ingresos, por eso comprara calzado que  tiene encargado por sus clientes y su compra la realizará en un mayor volumen con su nuevo credikiva. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias y Feliz Navidad y Próspero año nuevo, que sigan apoyando a los microempresarios como hasta ahora lo han hecho”.
texts.en: Eunice is requesting a new loan because she is very satisfied with what she has accomplished with her previous loan, thanks to which she has bought various products, food and even shoes: she has sold all these items thus increasing her profitability. She will now take advantage of the upcoming season as December is the best month of the year to sell the products she offers, and in this rich season she will sensibly increase her earnings. For this reason she will buy the shoes her customers have requested and she will purchase them in larger quantities thanks to her new loan. She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “Thank you very much, Merry Christmas and Happy New Year. May you keep on supporting the micro entrepreneurs like you have done up to now”.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y tambien vende leche en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la leche.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y alimentos para los ganados.
 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina continues to work in her livestock business, and she also sells milk in various markets in the Anta district.  She is able to provide for her children through this business.  Her dream is to have a store where she could sell milk.  Sabina requests a loan to buy milk and to buy feed for her livestock.

Sabina is happy to be getting this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, and to buy feed for her livestock

loans.name: Tsiyeregzen

texts.en:
Tsiyeregzen is 51 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a wooden house that is in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She sells various vegetables in the market. 

She requested a loan to purchase some necessary building materials to renovate her house because it has become too old and needs its flooring completely changed. Also, she will use her loan to increase her business capital for expanding her sales volume.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica de Silvia es preparar cena para los choferes que brindan servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo,verduras y arroz al por mayor.


El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Silvia is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She was born in the city of Cusco and that is where she does business.  Silvia's business is making prepared dinners for the public transportation drivers of the city of Cusco.  Silvia currently needs this loan to buy supplies, such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, noodles, and other things.

The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of responsible and hardworking people who get their families ahead.  The majority of its members live and work in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for being a big tourist attraction, for its business, for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration, and because it is the site of one of the seven wonder of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, vegetables and rice at wholesale prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat and women's purses for resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Nelly, La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras como zanahorias, lechuga, tomates entre otros, la socia vende las verduras a sus clientes que tiene en los mercados de Cusco y también lo envía a la ciudad  de Puerto Maldonado, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes  siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más verduras para enviar a Puerto Maldonado y comprar alimento para sus animalitos como pasto y alfalfa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres En Acción" (Women in Action), located in the district of Anta belonging to the province of Anta and department of Cusco. The member is Ms. Nelly, who combines her daily activities with her business of buying and selling vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, and tomatoes among others. The member sells the vegetables to her customers in the markets of Cusco and also sends them to the city of Puerto Maldonado. The member is a quite cheerful and responsible person. She also raises small animals such as hens and guinea pigs and in this manner gets her family ahead. 

The member is seeking the loan in order to purchase more vegetables to send to Puerto Maldonado and to buy food for her animals such as hay and alfalfa. The member is happy to receive the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to send to Puerto Maldonado and buy animal feed such as grass and alfalfa for her animals.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 49, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Emma, a housewife and mother to their six children. Romeo, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Romeo maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one tricycle (motorcycle with a sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He works from early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late in the evening until the wee hours in order to have a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of  Php300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of the business, he is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Romeo hopes to buy another tricycle unit and hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,la socia vende leche en el distrito de Tambo real y tambien lleva a las diferentes ferias en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la leche.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is still in the livestock-raising business. She sells milk in the Tambo Real district, and also takes her product to the various markets in Anta district. By means of this business, she is raising her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her milk. 

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy milk at wholesale.  She is happy about receiving the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy milk at wholesale prices

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de crianza de animales pero no le fue muy bien,pero ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,ella los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados y comprar alimentos para los ganados.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member previously was in the business of raising small animals but it didn't go very well for her, so now she is in the business of livestock farming. She gets them to grow and fatten up and then sells them at the various markets in the district of Anta. By means of this business the member wishes to get her children ahead. The member is seeking the loan for the purchase of livestock and feed for the livestock. 

The member is happy to receive the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Battsetseg wants to expand her business into frame crafting. She will open her frame craft shop this April and plans to purchase all of the equipment from abroad. It is a big business expansion for her selling business. Recently she has finished her workshop adjustments and decorations. Now she needs money support to purchase the equipment for preparing her frame craft workshop.

loans.use: To purchase the equipment needed to prepare her framing workshop.

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 1 Group

texts.en:
Teresa is the coordinator of her group, Luz y Esperanza ("Light and Hope"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Teresa plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling miscellaneous products. She will invest this loan to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics and accessories. She will use the profit to reinvest in her business and to save for the future. Before she started her business she couldn't save, but thanks to her business and these loans, her business is going well and she can save her profits. 

Teresa is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
“Start today, not tomorrow. If anything, you should have started yesterday. The earlier you start, the more time you have to mess up." (Emil Motycka)

Edgardo has the strong determination to achieve his desire. He is married, resides at Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, and is blessed with one angel of school age.

He is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He borrowed money in Paglaum MPC for the purpose of making a down payment on a motorcycle. He says the best way to predict the future is to create it.

loans.use: to make a down payment on a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sanjaapuntsag

texts.en: Mr. Sanjaapuntsag is a taxi driver in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his taxi for a year and already has had many customers. He lives with his wife and his daughter in an old wooden house that was built in the early 1970’s. His family has been living in this house for many years. However it has become very old and urgently needs to be renovated. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary building materials to make renovations on his old house.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary building materials to make renovations on his old house.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: María Inés de 41 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su  esposo que trabaja como mecánico y  su hijo que es menor de edad. Ella se dedica al negocio de tortillería y venta de huevos en su hogar de residencia. Tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a Dios y a sus esfuerzos ha logrado mantenerlo activo por mucho tiempo, además ha sido y continúa siendo su principal fuente de ingresos dado que su esposó no logra cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar con el poco  dinero que gana como mecánico. La señora María es una mujer increíble, carismática y trabajadora. Todos los días recorre los alrededores de su comunidad para ofrecer a las diferentes tiendas cartones de huevos. Posee varios clientes fijos  tanto en el comercio de huevos como en la venta de las deliciosas tortillas. Como toda mujer emprendedora no se cansa de trabajar y de apostar por una mejor calidad de vida, ha pensado mucho en la posibilidad de mejorar sus ingresos y ha llegado a la conclusión de  que la forma de hacerlo es invirtiendo en sus negocios para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder así mejorar sus ingresos. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar: huevos, leña, maíz, y de mas productos que le permitan mejorar su servicio. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Inés is 41 years old. She lives in her own house, along with her husband, who works as a mechanic, and their son, who is a minor. Her business is in her home, making and selling tortillas and selling eggs. She has been working at this business for a number of years, and thanks to God and to her efforts, she has succeeded in keeping it active for a long time. In addition, she has been and continues to be their principal source of income, given that her husband cannot manage to cover the basic household expenses with the little money that he earns as a mechanic. Señora Maria is an incredible woman, charismatic and hard-working. Every day she goes through the environs of her community to offer cartons of eggs to the various shops. She has a number of regular clients, as much for the egg business as for the sale of her delicious tortillas. Like every entrepreneurial woman, she does not tire of working and betting on a better quality of life. She has thought a lot about the possibility of improving her income, and she arrived at the conclusion that the way to do it is by investing in her businesses to give better service to her customers and thus be able to improve her income. This brought her to take the decision to apply for this loan at INTEGRAL to buy eggs, firewood, corn, and other products that will permit her to improve her service. She does all this with the goal of improving her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, firewood, corn, and other products that will permit her to improve her service

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As quoted by Napoleon Hill, ”If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way."

Josephine has the strong determination to achieve this desire. She is married, resides at Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, and is blessed with four children of school age. She is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She borrowed money in Paglaum MPC for the purpose of making full payment on a motorcycle. 

Therefore, Josephine has found that the best way to predict the future is to create it.

loans.use: to make full payment for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Amsa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 10/12/2010.IL est composé de 15 membres issus du même village.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce et la broderie. 

Elles ont pour responsable de groupe Mbène (elle est debout à droite sur la photo avec la main levée et habillée en mauve) Elle est âgée de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait le petit commerce de pagne et de parfums. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis des années. 

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son épargne dans le banc villageois
texts.en:
The group was formed on 10/12/2010. All of its 15 members are from the same village.  They primarily work together in small business and embroidery.

Mbène is the leader of their group (she is standing on the right with her hand raised wearing a mauve outfit). She is 30 years old, married and has two children.

She sells fabric and perfume. She has been in business for several years.

Her goal is to take care of her personal needs, help her husband with the household expenses and also increase her savings with the bank villageois.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and perfume.

loans.name: Yelba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Yelba, casada, de oficio Medico Ginecologa,  esta trabajando como medico en  cetro que apoya a las mujeres que sufren maltrato entre otros desde hace tres años.

 Su núcleo familiar la conforman su esposo, su hijo el que es  menor de edad, dice que entre los dos se han apoyado para salir adelante, del cual ella se presenta a nuestras oficina para solicitar este prestamos y de esta manera  mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que necesita realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda,  y requiere comprar materiales de construcción. Comenta que ella esta agradecida con ceprodel porque le ha dado el apoyo que actualmente ella esta teniendo.
texts.en:
Yelba is married and has been working for the last three years as a gynecologist in the medical center that helps women who suffer abuse and more.

Her nuclear family is made up of  her husband and her young son.  She says that between the two of them they have helped each other get ahead.  She came to our office to request these loans and with them improve her quality of life.  She needs to make some improvements on her house and she has to buy construction materials.  She tells us that she is appreciative of Ceprodel because it has give them the support that they now have.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, gravel, cement, stone, iron, stone chips, tiles, etc.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye est un jeune homme âgé de 29 ans qui vit dans une des localités du territoire sénégalais. C’est un célibataire, technicien électronique depuis 2004. Il a choisi cette spécialité sous l’influence de son oncle et est actuellement employé dans une société de la place. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour le complément d’un  montant qu’il détient et qui est destiné à acheter un taxi  qui lui aurait été livré il y’a de cela 6 mois. 
Son objectif est de s’assurer des revenus supplémentaires qui lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge ses dé penses personnelles(participer  plus significativement  a la dépense quotidienne, supporter le loyer et soutenir ses parents.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye is 29 years old and lives in a Senegalese village. He is single and has been an electronics technician since 2004. He chose the profession with his uncle's encouragement and is currently employed by a company. He is a member of U-IMCEC and is requesting a loan of 350,000 cfa francs to complete the money needed to buy a taxi which he intends to purchase within the next 6 months.
His goal is to make enough money to cover his personal expenses and contribute more to the daily expenses to help his household and his parents.

loans.use: complete the money necessary to purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre un et cinq ans. IL s’active  depuis 2009 dans le commerce c’est adire la vente de produits céréaliers tels que le mil, blé, et autres produits tel qu’aliments de bétail et foin. Il a choisi son activité de commerce par passion  mais aussi par recommandation de  ses parents. Mais ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les revenus générés par cette activité. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2004.  Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur au sein de l’institution ou il est membre. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de sacs de foins, de mil et de blé a revendre. Son  objectif est de  mieux  développer son activité commerce. Ainsi l’accroissement de ses revenus lui permettra d’améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Ousmane is 34 years old and lives in Senegal. He is married and has three children between the ages of one and three. He is in the business of selling grain products such as millet, wheat and other animal feed grains and hay. He chose the profession because he enjoys it, but also with encouragement by his parents. However, he's most focused on the income he can earn in this business. He has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since March 2004.  He has already properly reimbursed one loan with this institution. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 cfa francs to purchase sacks of hay, millet and wheat for resale. His goal is to grow the business. The increased income will thus help him to improve his family's social condition.

loans.use: achat de produits a revendre

loans.name: Manuela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Manuela, casada, reside en el municipio de nindiri departamento de Masaya, su nucleo familiar la componen 4 persona incluyendo a ella, su esposo y sus dos hijos, del cual son independientes.

Ella es dueña de su propio negocio el cual consiste en el alquiler de silla y mesas para todo tipo de eventos, ella comenta que en su localidad es la única que tiene ese negocio por lo cual no tiene competencia. 

Doña Manuela considera que este ayuda que obtiene de ceprodel le ha servido de mucho ya que a aumentado el numero de sillas y mesas y por ende incrementado el servicio que ella ofrece.
texts.en:
Manuela is married. She lives in the town of Nindiri in the department of Masaya. Her nuclear family consists of four people including herself, her husband and her two children who are independent.

She is the owner of her own business which consists of renting tables and chairs for all types of events. She comments that in her area she is the only one in this business so she has no competition.

Manuela believes that the help she receives from Ceprodel has helped her very much as she has been able to add to the number of chairs and tables and as a consequence she has increased the service that she offers.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Gloria De La Cruz

texts.es:
La sra. Gloria de la Cruz tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Delicias y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, Gloria de la Cruz es una mujer muy emprendedora y dedicada a su familia. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para empezar a producir sus sabrosas tortillas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de harina de maiz, cal, leña y agua, desea tener una mayor producccion ya que sus ventas han mejorado bastante, no cubre con todos los pedidos de sus clientes., 
Gloria de la Cruz es madre de 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica  a la contruccion.
texts.en:
Gloria de la Cruz is 50 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of Delicias and works in the preparation of tortillas. Gloria de la Cruz is an enterprising woman who is devoted to her family. 

Her business is located in her home. Every day she gets up early in order to begin making her delicious tortillas. 

She will use the money from the loan in order to buy corn flour, lime, wood and water. She wants to increase her production as her sales have increased and she can't fill all the requests from her customers. 

Gloria de la Cruz is the mother of three children who are students and she has the support of her husband who is a construction worker.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, lime, wood and water

loans.name: Belisario

texts.es:
El socio se sige dedicando al negocio de servicio de taxi,el trabaja en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro y comprar repuestos para los carros.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to work in the in the taxi business. He works on various streets in the city of Cusco. He works from 8:00AM until 5:00PM. 

Through this work the member is supporting his children. The dream of the member is to have a new car. 

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy spare automobile parts. 

The member is happy for the loan and he promises to make the agreed payments.

loans.use: to buy spare automobile parts

loans.name: Zaida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Zaida, casada, de 57 años de edad, es propietaria de su propio negocio en la elaboración de calzado de botas militares, desde hace 34 años,    reside en el departamento de Masaya. 

Se presenta a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de materia prima, ya que ella tiene pedidos,  sus puntos de ventas en la que ella distribuye es en  el oriental y ventas en el mercado de municipal de Masaya.
Considera que este crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su cálida de vida.
texts.en:
Zaida, married, is 57 years old. She is the owner of her own business making military boots, and has been doing this for 34 years. She lives in the department of Masaya.

She came to our offices to ask for a new loan to buy raw material as she already has orders. Her points of sales are a distribution point in the east and sales in the Masaya city market.

She thinks that this loan will help her increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for shoemaking such as leather, white and yellow glue, black snaps, rubber, standard soles, green ribbons, rivets, and laces

loans.name: Hercilia

texts.es:
La señora Hercilia   madre soltera con hijo de  once años de edad y viven  en una comunidad pequeña.

  El préstamo que ella solicito es para invertirlo en la compra de  frutas y verduras en donde lleva trabajando  tres años  y once mese en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  ha mejorado mucho sus ingresos para su hogar.
 
    Inicio por si sola ya solo depende de ella darle una vida mejora su pequeño hijo que esta estudiado, así con esta actividad podrá darle lo más necesario para pagar sus estudios.
 
    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando y con  el préstamo mejorar cada día más sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Hercilia is a single mother with an 11 year old child and they live in a little community.

The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy fruits and vegetables and she has been doing this work for 3 years and 11 months. She says that things are going well and that her household earnings have increased a lot.

She began by herself and has only herself to depend on to give a better life for her young son who is a student, and so with this activity she may be able to give him what he most needs and pay for his school fees.

What she wants the most is that with this activity she can continue working and with the loan increase her earnings each day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her business with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: José Mirtiliano

texts.es: José vende refrescos y bebidas desde el año 2002, época en la que quedo desempleado y para sostener su familia, decidió invertir su dinero y trabajar de manera independiente;  así fue como ubicó un espacio en su casa e inició en este lugar, que es un  punto muy estratégico, cerca a la plaza del municipio, donde los carnavales son una de las fiestas mas significativas para la población. El negocio de José con su trabajo y disciplina,  ha crecido gradualmente y en la actualidad lleva 3 financiamientos, a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Con él ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida y hoy su meta es continuar ampliándolo, especialmente en lo que se refiere al espacio locativo, para aumentar su oferta y brindar a los clientes un ambiente confortable, pero aun su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para cumplir con su sueño y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, cuarto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación, con el cual planea aumentar su capital de trabajo, invertir en refrescos, bebidas por cajas, aprovechando la temporada de carnaval que se acerca, época en la cual hay derroche de alegría, y mucha fiesta que contagia a sus clientes y estos,  gastan mas en divertirse y refrescarse, lo cual conviene al negocio de José.
texts.en:
José has been selling refreshing drinks since the year 2002, a time in which he became unemployed and so to support his family he decided to invest his money and work independently. Thus he allocated a space in his home and started up from this place, which is a very strategic point near the municipality's plaza where the days of Carnival constitute one of the most significant holidays for the population. With his work and discipline José's business has grown gradually, and currently he has had three loans through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

Thus he has succeeded in improving his lifestyle, and today his goal is to continue expanding his business, especially with regards to the location, so as to grow his line of merchandise and offer his customers a comfortable environment. However his working capital is still insufficient for fulfilling his dream, and this is precisely the reason for which he turns to his Kiva loan, the fourth loan he has taken out with the Foundation. With it he plans to expand his working capital and invest in soft drinks and other beverages by the box, taking advantage of the approaching Carnival season, a time during which happiness overflows and the partying spirit infects his customers who then spend more in amusements and refreshments, which is good for José's business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and other beverages by the box.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase carrots, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, green chiles, etc.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina is 63 years old, a widow with five adult children. She is from Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Rizalina used her last loan to purchase fertilizer. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to grow. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to grow

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно замужняя женщина у которой двое детей. Она домохозяйка , с домашними делами она занимается уходом за скотом в помощь своему мужу. Барно имеет несколько десятков коз, с которых она после стрижки производит из их шерсти пряжу и вяжет носки, которые пользуются спросом у населения. В данный момент её муж на заработках в России  и каждый месяц присылает ей на расходы, но Барно не надеется на переводы мужа и сама своей умелостью вязания справляется с семейными проблемами. На требуемый кредит она собирается купить пять коз с белой шерстью для увеличения своего дела.
texts.en: Barno is a married woman with two children. She is primarily a home maker but also takes care of the household's livestock to help out her husband. Barno owns a few dozen cashmere goats, whose wool she spins and makes socks for local sale. Currently her husband is away to work in Russia. While her husband has been sending monthly allowances for her and the children, Barno does not want to solely rely on this source of income and has been focusing on knitting and wool production as an alternative means to support the family. She is planning to use this loan to buy five more white fleeced goats for her herd to expand her knitting business.

loans.use: to buy five goats

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.ru: Абдуназар 32 летний молодой человек у которого жена и трое детей. По профессии  он строитель и опытный животновод, у него  несколько голов баранов и коз. Он в летний период работает на стройке, а зимой откармливает и продает скот, а в воскресные дни на рынке занимается куплей и продажей. Абдуназар не любит сидеть без дела, т.к вся семейная канитель у него на плечах. Жены данного региона нигде не работают, поэтому мужчинам трудновато, но они справляются, ведь они так воспитаны. Из-за  подешевления скота на рынке Абдуназар решил с помощью кредита увеличить скот и купить пять молодых баранов.
texts.en: Abdunazar is a 32 year old man with a wife and three children to support. He is a trained construction worker and, as an owner of a herd of sheep and goats, has a great deal of experience in animal husbandry. During the summer season Abdunazar works in construction and in winter he fattens and sells livestock, using the weekends to buy and sell animals on the market. He generally dislikes to be idle as he is solely responsible for financial well being of his family. Most women in the region do not work, and it is hard for the men to be sole providers, but they make due. Currently the market price of livestock has fallen and Abdunazar wants to seize the moment to buy five more sheep for his herd.

loans.use: to buy five sheep

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Абдумачид 37 летний опытный животновод, который с юности занимается откормом и продажей скота. У него три большие коровы, за которыми он ухаживает и откармливает. На полученную прибыль от данной деятельности он смог отремонтировать свой дом и купить новые ковры. Жена Абдумачида домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием  детей и  и домашними делами.  Она довольна работой мужа, за его работоспособность, т.к. кроме откорма он электрик  и в свободное время работает по вызову по своей профессии, от чего и получает дополнительный доход. На полученный кредит он планирует купить ещё пару коров с телёнком.
texts.en: Abdumajid is 37 year old cattleman with years of experience. He has been raising and selling cattle since childhood. He is currently fattening and taking care of three big cows. By using profits from his cattle business Abdumajid has been able to repair his house and buy additional cows for himself. His wife is a home maker and takes care of their children and all the household duties. She is happy with her husband's business and his hardworking attitude. Aside from cattle sales Abdumajid also works as an electrician and uses weekends to freelance which yields additional profits for the family. Abdumajid is planning to use this loan to buy two more cows with a calf.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Anor

texts.ru: Анор проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Анор занимается торговлей парфюмерии и наборов для новорожденных. В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки детских костюмчиков.
texts.en: Anor lives in the city of Khujand. She is 51 years old, married and has two children. Anor sells cosmetics and outfits for newborn babies. She has been managing her market stall for ten years. Anor is taking out this loan to purchase more baby outfits.

loans.use: to purchase outfits for newborn.

loans.name: Koe Pyahu Group

texts.es:
Ko``e Pyahu se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, gracias a que una de las miembros del grupo, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 3° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Sonia es una de estas mujeres, ella trabaja todos los días en su pequeña heladería. Ella nos dice que por medio de este negocio ella puede mantener a su hogar y darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para tener una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Se define como una mujer muy emprendedora que no teme trabajar, pues todo lo que hace es para su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de helados, de diferentes sabores, con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que estamos en tiempos de  mucho calor y es cuando más ventas tienen.
texts.en:
Koe Pyahu is the name of an excellent group of women established in the city of Villa Elisa, thanks to one of the members of the group who contacted the consultant in a weekly meeting that they had in the area in order to find out about the work of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. Once she was well-informed about the program she was able to connect the 16 women who are now comfortably working already in their third cycle, together and supportive within the program.

Sonia is one of these women. She works every day in her little ice cream shop. She tells us that through this work she can maintain her home and give her family all that they need in order to have a decent life without hardships like those she went through. She is known as a woman entrepreneur who is not afraid of work; all that she does is for her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy ice cream, of different flavors, with which she may have more variety to be able to offer to her customers, as we are in the very hot season and it is when she has more sales.

loans.use: to buy ice cream for later resale

loans.name: Luis Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre muy empeñoso de 49 años de edad, el es padre de un hijo de 17 años al cual ha criado solo desde muy pequeño y por el cual trata de salir adelante cada día, Daniel vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad de clima cálido y en el cual se ubican hermosas playa y cuya actividad principal es la pesca.

Daniel se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, le gusta mucho lo que hace e incluso a veces se encariña mucho con los cerditos más pequeños, viene trabajando en este negocio desde hace 2 años, con mucho sacrificio y lucha constante, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 3 horas, el se levanta muy temprano ya que hay que alimentar a los cerdos, limpiar el lugar donde comen porque Daniel nos cuenta que ellos son como las personas donde está limpio comen bien, si está sucio no les gusta, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado a su trabajo y porque cría a los animales con respeto.

Daniel está muy feliz de la ayuda brindada por los prestatarios kiva, ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar el alimento balanceado por mayor (ya que cuando se compra en pocas cantidades es muy caro); con esta mejora el podrá darle una mejor alimentación a los cerdos y con ello los clientes estarán más seguros de comprar la carne de los mismo y sobre todo porque tendrá mas ingresos para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” que su hijo continúe con sus estudios para que sea mejor que el porque lo único que puede heredarle si algo le sucediera es la educación”.
texts.en:
Daniel is a very active man of 49 years of age, the father of a 17-year-old son whom he has raised by himself since the son was very young, and for whom he tries to get ahead every day. Daniel lives in the city of Pisco which has a hot climate, and where there are beautiful beaches and fishing is the main industry. 

Daniel earns a living raising pigs. He enjoys what he does very much, and at times he even gets quite attached to the smallest little pigs. He has been working in this business for two years with much sacrifice and constant struggle. He devotes himself to his business around three hours, getting up very early since he must feed the pigs and clean the area where they eat, because, Daniel tells us, they are like people in that where it's clean they eat well but if it's dirty they don't like it. He believes his business is going well because he's very dedicated to his work and because he raises the animals with respect. 

Daniel is very happy for the help offered by the Kiva lenders, since owing to that support he will be able to purchase commercial feed wholesale (since when one buys in small quantities it is very expensive). With this improvement he will be able to provide better nutrition to the pigs and thus the customers will be more confident in buying their meat. Above all he will have more income to be able to fulfill his great dream: "that his son would stay in school in order to be better than him, because the only thing he can leave him as an inheritance, in case something were to happen to him, is education."

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр житель города Худжанд. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает детские костюмчики, носки и женское нижнее белье. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in Khujand. He is 32 years old, married and has one child. Bakhtiyor sells clothing at the local market. He has a market stall specialized in children outfits, socks and women's underwear. He has been managing his stall for seven years. Bakhtiyor is taking out this loan to purchase seasonal clothes.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Mineras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MINERAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Dionicia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de edredones y cortinas, tejido de chalecos, elaboración de flecos para living y cortinas, costura de chalecos.

La señora Dionicia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las agencias distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda a poyar a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos
texts.en:
The “MINERAS” communal bank is initiating its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima regional center. It is made up of six members and led by a board of directors, headed by Dionicia. The businesses carried out by the communal bank's members are varied, including: weaving blankets; selling comforters and curtains; weaving vests; making fringe for home decoration and curtains; and tailoring vests. 

Dionicia reports that it is her first time working with Pro Mujer, and she joined the institution on the invitation of the promoters. Currently, she has a business weaving blankets; she has been working in this area for years. 

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital (buying wool). She will acquire the wool from distributing agencies and use it to create her products, which are sold in response to orders. This way of working helps her support her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has four children.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Daane Doolé Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Daane Doolé" est constitué de 5 femmes qui s'activent toutes dans la teinture de tissus. Elles habitent le même quartier et ont suivi une formation en techniques de teinture qui leur a été par une monitrice.Après s'être cotisées pendant trois mois, elles ouvrent un compte à l'UIMCEC oû elles constituent une petite épargne.Elles sont toutes mariées et ont des enfants.Le chef du groupe ( au milieu) est mère de trois enfants dont les deux vont à l'école. Elles vend des tissus et des habits teints au marché de sa localité. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de ses enfants.Pour augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les femmes sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus, des colorants et d'autres produits divers de teinture.Leurs ambition est d'implanter une cantine au marché pour exposer et vendre leurs production.
texts.en: The Daane Doolé group consists of five women who are all involved in textile dyeing. They live in the same neighborhood and have gone through an instructor-led training to learn the techniques of dyeing.  After putting resources together for three months, they have opened an account with UIMCEC where they now have some savings.  They are all married and have children.  The leader of the group (standing in the middle in the photo), is the mother of three children, two of whom attend school.  She sells fabrics and dyed clothes at the local market.  With the revenues that her business generates, she is able to take care of her own needs and to provide for her children.  In order to boost their business, the members of the group are requesting a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used to buy fabrics, dyes, and various other dyeing products.  Their goal is to open a stall at the market in order to show and sell their products.

loans.use: to by fabrics, dyes, and various other dyeing products.

loans.name: Elder Omar

texts.es:
Elder Omar de 24 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, vive en la Colonia Mi Única Esperanza, San Pedro Sula.
Elder tiene 3 años de experiencia en la reparación de motocicletas, anteriormente trabajaba como operario en una maquila por dos días y los otros 4 días los trabajaba en un taller de motocicletas.  Hace un año que decidió establecer su propio negocio con el propósito de obtener mejores ingresos, ofrece servicios de reparación de motocicletas a domicilio. Sus clientes son personas que tienen ruta (es decir los vendedores ambulantes en motocicletas), personas particulares y empleados de empresa privada, lo contactan vía teléfono cuando requieren de sus servicios. 
Esta solicitando L.5,000.00 para la compra de un taladro de mesa y otras herramientas que necesita para brindar un mejor servicio.
Su sueño es mejorar el taller para brindar un buen servicio y obtener mejores ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Elder Omar is 24 years old. He is married and has one four-year-old child. He lives in the Mi Única Esperanza neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Elder has three years of experience repairing motorcycles. Previously he worked as a machine operator in a maquiladora two days a week and the other four he would work at a motorcycle mechanic shop. A year ago he decided to start his own business with the objective of making a better income. He offers home motorcycle repair services. His customers are people who have routes (that is to say, they are sales people who make their sales door to door on a motorcycle), individuals, and employees of private companies. They get in touch with him via telephone when they need his services.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 lempiras to purchase a table drill and other tools that he need to offer better service. His biggest dream is to improve his workshop in order to offer better service and make a better income for his home.

loans.use: to buy a table drill and tools to repair motorcycles.

location.town: Mi Unica Esperanza, San Pedro Sula

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Cuando Marlene inició su actividad mercantil lo hizo vendiendo frutas y trabajando fuertemente, por lo cual gradualmente su capital aumentó, por eso decidió dos años después, comprar mercancías para montar su propia miscelánea  y vender refrigerios en la tienda escolar de un colegio en su mismo barrio.
