También con sus buenas ventas obtendrá mejores utilidades para apoyar el sustento de su hogar y aumentar su bienestar. Con su credikiva anterior le fue muy bien y por eso está muy satisfecho porque compró insumos para la producción de miel, marcos, cera cajas y techos para sus colmenas.
texts.en: Miguel is applying for his second credikiva with which he will buy pigs, sheep for slaughter, taking advantage of the good time for his business because sales have increased and he is able to sell them easily retail and wholesale. With his good sales he will have greater earnings to support his home and increase his wellbeing. With his previous credikiva, Miguel, did very well which is why he is so content since he bought the merchandize needed to make honey like frames, honeycombs, boxes and roofs for his beehives.

loans.use: buy pigs and sheep for slaughter.

loans.name: Luis German

texts.es: Luis de 56 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene un hijo de 16 años. El es propietario de un negocio de variedades y de una peluquería donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal a hombres, mujeres y niños; así mismo vende en su miscelánea productos de belleza y accesorios femeninos y para el hogar. Su negocio lo inició hace diez años, cuando  quedó desempleado trabajando en una peluquería y aprovechó su experiencia para dedicarse a esa misma actividad. Gradualmente fue agregando otros productos, aprovechando su clientela doméstica, a quien asesoraba a cerca del uso de los productos cosméticos y así inició otra fuente de ingresos en su mismo espacio comercial. En la actualidad tiene su propia casa, gracias al apoyo que le dio la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en el macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, y con este ha recibido dos financiamientos, para capital de trabajo por parte de esta organización. Con su credikiva comprará mercancías, que vienen en descuentos en sus guías especializadas de productos, como cosméticos y productos de belleza, que acompaña con sus ya famosas asesorías en belleza y estética. Su meta más adelante es tener un gran local, para mudar su negocio a un espacio mucho más confortable, con el fin de continuar mejorando su servicio al cliente.
texts.en: Luis is 56 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena and has a 16 year old son. He is the owner of a miscellaneous shop and a hairdresser/barbershop where he offers personal image improvement for men, women and children; at the same time he sells his miscellaneous beauty products and accessories for women and the home. Luis began his business ten years ago when he became unemployed after working in a hairdresser/barbershop and took advantage of his experience to open his own shop. Little by little, he began to add new products and taking advantage of his family clientele whom he gave advice about beauty products and that is how another source of income started in his workplace. At present, Luis lives in his own home thanks to the support given to him by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the Bicentenary City macroproject, where he received two loans as work capital. With his credikiva he will buy merchandize that are on sale in his specialized product guides like makeup and beauty products that go with his already famous beauty and aesthetic accessories. Luis’ goal is to have a great place to move his business, a more comfortable space to keep improving his customer service.

loans.use: buy merchandize on sale like makeup and beauty products.

loans.name: Alcatraces Group

texts.es:
Anita, perteneciente del grupo Alcatraces, esposa y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a distribuir deliciosas tortillas de harina. A ella le gusta mucho preparar comidas, y en festividades del año o días especiales preparaba tortillas de harina para compartir con sus vecinas. Tenía la costumbre de llevarles y siempre eran muy bien recibidas. Se dio la ocasión en que algunas vecinas, le preguntaban “si no le habían quedado tortillas” a la hora de la comida porque tenían antojo. Fue entonces que sus hijos la motivaron a iniciar un micronegocio por pedido, fijar un precio y hacer cuando se lo requerían.
Anita ha solicitado este crédito para renovar su equipo de trabajo y establecer un espacio dentro de casa dedicado al negocio.
Ahora ella recibe con frecuencia estas solicitudes para satisfacer este rico antojo y además comenzó a distribuir en tiendas de abarrotes cercanas.
texts.en: Anita is a member of the Alcatraces group and is married with two children.  She earns her living distributing delicious flour tortillas.  She enjoys preparing food, especially for festive holidays during the year to share with her neighbors.  When she took them around they were always well received.  Several of her neighbors began asking for her tortillas at mealtimes when they were desired.  As a result, her children suggested that she start a small business to respond to client orders, fixing prices and making tortillas when they were needed.  Anita seeks this credit to operationalize her equipment for making flour tortillas and to establish a space within her home for her business acitivities.  Now she receives frequent client orders and is even distributing to nearby stores.

loans.use: to acquire equipment for making flour tortillas

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es: Anibal con su credikiva compró repuestos para computadores , quemadores, memorias, parlantes, filtros y hasta le alcanzo para comprar mercancia variada que vendió como juguetes y musica. Con su nuevo crédito comprará pantalones colegiales, camisas, y productos de papelería pues se prpara para la temporada de colegios y desde ya quiere tener todo lo que sus clientes exigen usualmente. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Que sigan apoyando esta labor, porque es muy importante para el mejoramiento de la vida de muchas comunicdades y tambien en el logro de muchos sueños , tambien quiero desearles, feliz navidad en nombre de mi familia."
texts.en: Anibal used his Credikiva loan to buy computer spare parts: burners, memory drives, speakers, filters, and even had some left over to buy miscellaneous merchandise, which he sold as toys and music.  With the new loan he plans to buy school trousers, shirts and stationery products since he is getting ready for the school year to begin and wants to have on hand everything his customers usually request.  His message to the Kiva lenders is the following:  "Please continue supporting this initiative because it is very important in improving lives in many communities and in helping many dreams come true.  I also want to wish you a Merry Christmas on behalf of my family.".

loans.use: To buy school trousers, shirts and stationery products.

loans.name: Mbene

texts.fr: Madame Mbene   est une femme âgée  de 45 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 5 et 18 ans. Elle évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de poissons. Les revenus de mari étant insuffisants  pour supporter les charges  quotidiennes, elle a choisi cette activité pour se procurer des revenus et venir en aide a la famille. Par conséquent c’est l’aspect lucratif qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2009. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs montant avec lequel elle compte s’approvisionner en poissons pour les revendre a ses clients. Ainsi son objectif est de maintenir le niveau de son activité pour pouvoir continuer à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mbene, age 45, lives in Senegal. She's married and the mother of five children, whose ages range from 5 to 18. For more than ten years, she's been a merchant selling fish. 

Since her husband's income is not enough to take care of the daily expenses, she chose this business to earn an income and help her family. As a consequence, she's mainly interested in the lucrative aspect of her business.

She's been a member of one of UIMCEC's branches since September 2009, and already repaid two previous loans. She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, which she intends to use to purchase fish supplies to resell to her customers.

Her goal is to maintain her level of business in order to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Bousso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra Bousso a été crée le 21 septembre 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues de la même localité qui sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles exercent la même activité le commerce.

Oumy(Debout à droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02enfants et a en charge 01 autre enfant sa cousine. 

Elle fait le petit commerce d'habits (pagnes brodés) des colliers en perle, des légumes. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va renforcer son activité. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et de satisfair ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Solidarity Group Sop Mame Diarra Bousso was established on September 21, 2010. It is made up of twelve women from the same village. They got united by bonds of kinship and neighborhood, and are all merchants.

Oumy, standing on the right in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children. In addition, she also has to support one of her cousin's children.

She retails clothes, such as embroidered "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), pearl necklaces, and vegetables. With her loan, she will bolster her business.

Her profits will enable her to support her husband in taking care of the family, and to provide for her own personal needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 1 child. 

Laura has a computer shop that provides computer and online games where customers drop coins into computers.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to pay for the electricity for the computer services.

Laura has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 .  In the future, Laura hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for the electricity for the computer services.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 24 years old, single and has run a retail shop for the past five years.  The business earns him a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He has requested for a loan worth KES 30,000 to expand his business by buying more stock like stationery, milk, soda for sale. 

Edwin says that his profit from the business will assist him to further his education because he is still in college.  His hope and dream is to become a reliable business entity to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock like stationery, milk, soda for sale.

loans.name: Jocylita

texts.en:
Jocylita is fifty years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jocylita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jocylita has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Jocylita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 52-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children who one of whom is studying while the others are working. He’s the one responsible for his family, and doing the best he can to enrich their standard of living. 

Hasan decided to open his own cattle farm in 1990 and already has thirty years of experience in this domain. He likes his job and knows very well that with a little more care, the business will grow faster. Today, he’s requesting a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase cattle in order to raise them and increase his milk production. He notes that this will help to develop his business and augment his profits. In the future, he plans to enlarge his farm by purchasing additional animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to raise them and increase his milk production.

loans.name: Dominico

texts.en:
Dominico is 53 years old, married and a father of two children. He runs a retail shop in Mpeketoni, Lamu and has been in the business for the last twelve years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of KES 40,000 from the company. He intends to use it to add additional stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and Vaseline to sell. 

He will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for his children. In future, he hopes to grow his business and turn it into a well stocked supermarket.

loans.use: to add additional stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and Vaseline to sell.

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Arline has a shop that makes and sells snacks like pancakes and rice cakes. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients to make snacks. 

Arline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children. 

Cynthia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cynthia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Cynthia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 9 children. 

Virginia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 15 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 25 year old business man who sells second hand shoes in Mariakani.  He has been selling shoes to his customers for the past one year and he is doing great. 

This marks his first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business.  He plans to add more stock of second hand shoes for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and expand his business further.  He hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: To add more stock of second hand shoes for sale.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 5 children. 

Cecelia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cecelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Cecelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 33 years old from Nakuru and is married to Sylvester.  They have three children who are between the ages of 13 and six years old.

Annie has a food stall that she has run for the past 14 years.  She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her buy more fruits for sale. 

She hopes to expand her business and open more stalls.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Mayra Auxiliadora

texts.es: Mayra Auxiliadora es una emprendedora que ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en cual es una persona responsable y nos expresa ella que gracias al financiamiento ha aumentado su inventario y sus clientes, ya que hoy en día a sus clientes les ofrece variedad de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para esta temporada que es buena en el cual quiere aprovechar, ella comprara con el crédito ropa de todo estilo, cosmetido, zapatos entre otros productos que demandan.
texts.en:
Mayra Auxiliadora is an entrepreneur that has had a loan with Fundación León 2000. She is a responsible person and tells us that thanks to the financing her inventory and customers have increased since these days she offers them a variety of clothing, cosmetics, and shoes.

Currently she is requesting a loan for this season she wants to take advantage of. With the loan she will buy clothing of all styles, cosmetics, and shoes, among other products that her customers want.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all styles, cosmetics, and shoes, among other products in demand.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre en sus estudios a sus pequeños para que logren realizar un carrera profesional, don Oscar esta muy contento con los resultados que obtuvo gracias a Kiva, logro invertir mas en sus cultivos y ahora cuenta con un cuatro mas de producción de piña, pero no tiene el capital para inducir el cultivo y evitar plagas futuras ; ya que el precio de este productos para esta temporada baja y solo logro sacar lo que le habían financiado y espera que siempre le sigan apoyando.
texts.en: Oscar and his family live in Ticuantepe.  His plans for the future are to improve his family's living conditions and to support his children's studies so that they can have a professional career.  Oscar is very pleased with the results he has obtained thanks to Kiva, which allowed him to invest more in his farming.  He has already increased his production of pineapples by a quarter.  But he does not have enough money to grow more plants and to protect against future pests, since the price for these products during this season is low, and he only earned as much as he invested.  He hopes that you will continue to support him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 

Gina has a green house that sells fruit trees and non-fruit trees seedlings.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for fruit trees seedlings.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 .  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for fruit trees seedlings.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
43-year-old Marites is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol.  She is married with 4 children who are between the ages of 8 and 15 years old.

Marites primarily grows rice crops to sell to her community.  She earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business.  Marites works hard to increase her harvest to earn more money.  She said she wants the best for her family.  Marites plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.  This will help Marites achieve a better yield.

Marites hopes for her children to finish college and have brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 29-year-old married woman with 2 children who are enrolled in school.  Her husband is a chef who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Rebecca has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past 1 year; her potential clients are the local area residents.  She faces a major challenge of rough roads which make it difficult to work.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase another motorbike for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike for her business.

loans.name: Ainea

texts.en:
Ainea is 46 years old. He is from Nakuru and is married to Lina. They have four children who are aged between nineteen and ten years of age. 

Ainea is in the animal sales business. He has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit. 

He hopes to own as many cows as possible in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 43-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her two working siblings. They’re all cooperating together to be able to cover their expenses. As for Zahra, she has been working as a private teacher since 1995 from her home. She’s intelligent and expert in her field. In parallel, she has been teaching in a local school since 1990. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan of $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to build a room where she can teach her students and have some privacy. In that way, she will be able to develop her way of teaching thus her communication with her students. In the future, she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to build a room where she can teach her students and have some privacy.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is forty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with eleven children. 

Allan provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline he uses for his motorela services.

Allan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Allan hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a fifty-one-year-old rental houses owner in Kilifi. He is married and a father of twelve. He has been a landlord for the past twenty years with great success. 

This is Ronald’s second business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to renovate his rental houses. He will use the anticipated profits to construct more residential houses to rent. 

He hopes to sufficiently support his family.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
24-year-old Melodina is a married woman with a two-year-old child. She sells fish for a living. Her husband, who is a fisherman, catches fish to sell. Melodina also buys from other fishermen so they have more fish to sell at the market. Melodina works hard to support her family. 

She applied for a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Melodina hopes to earn more money and be able to save for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en:
Khadijeh is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married and lives with her husband and three school-age children. She joins forces with her husband in order to cover their life expenses and pay the cost of their children's studies. 

Khadijeh opened her own flower shop in 2004; she also has a small clothing area in the shop. Today, she wants to borrow $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added products for her shop such as flowers and a new collection of clothes. This will certainly increase the number of customers asking for her services and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop by adding diverse kinds of flowers.

loans.use: to buy added products for her shop such as flowers and a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Alma is a married woman with five children aged between eleven and nineteen. Alma's husband works as a fisherman.

Alma runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like spices, coffee, soap and shampoo. Alma earns about PHP 5,000 with her store. She said the store is helpful in providing for her family's daily needs. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as coffee, canned goods and noodles. She hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as coffee, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 48 años es un padre responsable. Vive en compañía de Rosa, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen una hija Lisbeth a la que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. Su mayor objetivo es comprar una máquina de 2 agujas planas, con lo que podrá ahorrar tiempo en la confección de sus materiales. En torno a esta premisa trabaja muy duro en compañía de sus hermanas, esposa y sobrinas. Quienes confeccionan junto a él sombreros y gorros deportivos publicitarios para ferreterías, grifos y veterinarias. Ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a esto, según cuenta cuando comenzó en este negocio, llevaba a vender sus gorros a las ferias de las diferentes ciudades del país, con el tiempo le hacían pedidos los comerciantes mayoristas, ahora solo trabaja para empresas. Obtiene buenas ganancias con la venta de sus productos, pues es un hombre trabajador y responsable. “tengo que luchar para terminar de pagar los estudios universitarios de mi hija y que sea una gran profesional”, comenta. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. José de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas y viseras para confeccionar gorros.
texts.en:
José, 48, is a good father.  He lives with Rosa, his wife of 20 years.  They have a daughter, Lisbeth, whom they are raising in their own house, located in  El Tambo. His main goal is to buy a sewing machine with two flat needles so he can save time in preparing his materials.  For this reason, he has been working very hard, along with his sisters, wife, and nieces.  Together, they make hats and baseball caps used for advertising by hardware stores, plumbers, and veterinaries. He has been in this line of business for 10 years; he says that when he started out, he traveled around the different cities of the country to sell his caps.  Over time, he started to receive orders from wholesalers and, now, he only works for these businesses.  He makes a good living from selling his products, since he is a hardworking and responsible man.  "I have to fight on so that we can finish paying my daughter's university tuition and so she can become a great professional," he comments.

This is his fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, which he hopes will allow him to realize his plans.  He promises to meet his payments.  He is grateful to be part of this association, as all the members are responsible  and neighborly people.  José will use his loan to buy fabric and visors to make baseball caps.

loans.use: to buy fabric and visors to make baseball caps.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en:
Khadijeh is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are still attending school. She has been working at selling clothes from her home since 2009, and she’s now cooperating with her husband in order to get higher revenues to be able to cover their children’s educational fees. Her husband has been working in a local company for the past two years. 

Today, she wants to borrow $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added clothes for her shop, such as men's and children’s wear. She notes that this Kiva loan will increase her sales and thus her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase added clothes for her shop, such as men's and children’s wear.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 33 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, aged 8 and 4. Milagros' husband works as a farmer.

Milagros is also a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 5 years. She earns about 3,000 Php per month doing this farming. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies. She hopes this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 39-year-old married woman with 7 children. The oldest child is 16 years old. Rosie's husband works as a farmer.

Rosie is also engaged in farming. She helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops. While her husband mainly manages their farm, Rosie finds ways to earn an extra income. She makes banana cue and rice cakes to sell in her community. She works hard to help provide for their needs and send their kids to school.

She requested a loan to buy raw ingredients and farm fertilizers. She hopes for this loan to help improve her family's ventures.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 42-year-old widowed woman with 2 children who attend school. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Amina has operated a nursery school for the past 10 years. In addition, she is also a tailor. Her potential clients are the local area villagers' children. She faces a major challenge of rent expenses for her school premises. She dreams of establishing a primary school.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more books, stationery, desks, tables and chairs for her school. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more books, stationery, desks, tables and chairs for her school.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a thirty-one-year-old married man, from Gaza. Sami lives with his wife and six children. He is a well-known carpenter who has been in his business for about ten years. 

He hopes that thanks to this this loan he will be able to improve the condition of his store by buying new machines and equipment. He believes this will increase his income as well.

loans.use: to buy new machines and equipment.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is fifty-three years old and is a married woman with two children aged eighteen and fourteen. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Antonia has been buying and selling fish for eight years. She is able to support her family with her business. Antonia plans to use her loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to be able to send her two children to college.

In the future, Antonia hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Stella has a business selling cosmetics. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days a week. Stella sells her products in a retail shop. Stella has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxer, Vaseline, braids and weaves.

The main business challenges for Stella include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of cosmetics.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop selling cosmetics and also to build her own house. Stella lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxer, Vaseline, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Arcelita is a married woman with six children aged between two and twelve. Arcelita's husband works as a fisherman.

Arcelita is a fish vendor. She sells her husband's catch and also buys fresh fish from other fishermen. Arcelita works hard to earn money and be able to provide for her family's needs. She requested a loan to buy more fishing nets and hooks. This will help Arcelita and her husband have more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 27 years old and a computer bureau owner in Shanzu, Mombasa. He is single, and his bureau has been in operation for the past three years. He is doing great.

This is his third business loan from KADET LTD, to finance his business. He plans to purchase new computers, a photocopying machine and a laminator. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase new computers, a photocopying machine and a laminator.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 58 years old and a married woman with 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Felisa and her husband work together to make ends meet. She sells her husband's catch at the market. She does her best to keep her family healthy.

She has requested a loan to purchase a boat engine. This will help her and her husband earn more from fishing.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a 36-year-old married woman with 6 children who attend school. Her husband is a mechanic who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past 8 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of customers' delay in paying their debts on time. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, sugar and detergents for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access fund to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, sugar and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 40 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children aged between eighteen and twenty-five. They are presently in school and live at home. 

For the past six years she has been running a shop where she sells fashion clothes including blouses, jam trousers, hand bags, and lappa (traditional cloth) to her community. She has a lot of customers and makes a lots of profit since she is the only one who sells fashion clothes in the community, especially during the Christmas season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business. She plans to expand her business and send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y tambien la socia vende leche y queso en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender leche y queso.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y queso al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues dedicating herself to the business of livestock, and also of selling milk and cheese in the different markets that exist in the district of Anta.  By means of this business, the member helps her children get ahead.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell milk and cheese.  The member requests this loan to buy milk and cheese at wholesale.

The member is happy for the loan, and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: buy milk and cheese at wholesale.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a 43-year-old married woman with four children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a nurse who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mbodze has operated a tailoring business for the past fifteen years; her potential clients are the residents of the local area. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a cosmetics shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth and embroideries for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and embroideries for her business.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She started working twenty years ago, trading in Brazilian Gold. Her business is improving because of her customers' trust, and because true gold isn't affordable to their budget at all as it's much too expensive to buy.

May is a hardworking woman, and she works her best to help her husband make their living. Family expenses are increasing, and that's why she has to improve her income through increasing her Brazilian Gold collection and to support the cosmetics trade she started earlier. For this reason, she is applying for a loan from KIVA Partner "Al Majmoua". She is one of Al Majmoua's loyal borrowers, and now she's applying for her 13th loan cycle, with an excellent reputation and paying back history. She believes that Al Majmoua is the most important reason for her business improvement.

She hopes to open a jewelry shop one day to rest from seeking after customers, and to keep her house just for her family's rest and not to accept customers in it.

loans.use: To increase her Brazilian Gold collection and to support her cosmetics trade.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has one child who doesn't go to school. Hellen has a business selling animal and poultry feed. She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days a week. Hellen sells her products in a retail shop. 

Hellen has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of chicken and poultry feed. She also generates additional income through rearing chicken. The main business challenges for Hellen include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van. Hellen lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of animal and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Luis se dedica a la modificación de motos antiguas mediante el tuneo que en el mundo del automóvil, sinónimo de la personalización de un vehículo motorizado a través de diferentes modificaciones de la mecánica para mayor rendimiento, y también aplicado popularmente a cambios exteriores de la carrocería e incluso interiores de la cabina de las mismas con líneas modernas sacadas de motos de carrera actuales, comprende la modificación completa a pedido y especificación del cliente, se dedicas a esta actividad hace varios años, teniendo a su cargo un aprendiz en moldeo de fibra de vidrio, cuenta con domicilio familiar de sus padres, no posee créditos en otro lado y parece demostrar responsabilidad en los montos a sacar siempre analizando su capacidad de pago. el crédito lo pide para equipar su taller con gatas hidráulicas para facilitar su trabajo ya que estas levantan las motos a una altura adecuada para su modificación.
texts.en:
José Luis dedicates himself to the alteration of old motorcycles by means of tune-ups that, in the automotive world, are synonymous to the customization of a motor vehicle through various mechanical modifications for increased performance.  He has also applied himself to popular exterior changes of the body and, inclusive, the cabin interiors of the same with modern parts taken from newer bikes.  He completes the entire modification on request and at the specification of the customer.  

He has dedicated himself to this activity for various years, having in his charge an apprentice in fiberglass molds.  He counts on the family home of his parents, doesn’t have loans in other places and appears to demonstrate responsibility in the amounts he borrows by always analyzing his ability to repay them.  He asks for the loan to equip his workshop with hydraulic jacks to facilitate his work, as these lift the motorcycles to an adequate height for being modified.

loans.use: buy tools for his workshop (hydraulic jacks).

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a thirty-three-year-old business man, he is married to Helen who is a business lady. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a butchery as a primary business and a hotel as a secondary business for the past ten years. He has a monthly income of KES 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his 1st loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. George will use the loan to buy a bull to slaughter and a stock of sugar and rice for the hotel.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant which will help improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a bull to slaughter and a stock of sugar and rice for his hotel.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 49-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has worked for 31 years in car maintenance, specializing in fixing cars' electric problems and in changing oil. His wide experience gave him his customers'  trust and support, and that's why he puts so much effort into pleasing them as much as he can.

Walid applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase his stock of oil with different kinds and prices that fit his customers' needs, in addition to updating his machines with new ones.

He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles, and he is assured that his last loan affected his social life positively. He hopes to expand his business and then rest, watching his business growing more and more.

loans.use: To increase his stock of lubricant oils and update his machines.

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
Rosa Yolanda  tiene 32 años, es casada vive  con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

La ventanilla TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Matilde Esther perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla son 11 socios y se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, cacao, naranja y plátano ya en esta zona es humedad y se dan estos productos, además se dedican a la crianza de animales de corral.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja y crianza de pollos y chanchos Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes y en el Recinto Matilde Esther.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y cacao y para alimento cono balanceado para los animales. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar la produccion de los animales de corral como los pollos que es lo que mas de la utilidad.

Le gusta el carnaval ya que en esta fecha se reune la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Yolanda is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Chillanes canton, province of Bolívar. She has 5 children. 
The Community Bank Trabajadores Agricolas is located in Recinto Matilde Esther, which is part of the canton of Cillanes. This community bank is composed of 11 members who work in short cycle agriculture growing corn, cocoa, oranges, and bananas as this area is wet and these crops grow there. They also raise animals.
Rosa is a farmer and grows cocoa, coffee, and oranges and raises chickens and pigs. She buys her supplies from Mata de Cacao at the end of every month and sells her produce in the Sunday markets in Chillanes and in Recinto Matilde Esther.
She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for sowing corn and cocoa and for nutritious animal feed. The loan will help her to increase her revenue and meet her family's needs and to invest. Her dream is to have more livestock like chickens as they are of the greatest use. 
She likes carnival because her family comes together on that day.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for sowing corn and cocoa and for nutritious animal feed

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 25-year-old single man, working in selling computers and laptops, and he has provided internet services since 2004. He's almost the only one in his region and has to take good care of his business to keep his customers' trust and to prevent any future competition. He is a man with a good reputation, smart enough to know his customers' needs, and he works on providing the best customer service ever.

He is intending to increase his computer accessories income through new collections recently released. This will give a wide variety to his customers and gives them the motive to buy without the need. 

For this reason, Alaa applied for the first time for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He will also use part of the loan to fix his car because he had an accident, since the car is necessary for his business to go to the dealers and buy the requested products.

loans.use: To increase his computer accessories income through newly released collections.

loans.name: Mayra Carmen

texts.es:
Mayra Carmen  tiene 32 años, es casada vive  con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

La ventanilla TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Matilde Esther perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla son 11 socios y se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, cacao, naranja y plátano ya en esta zona es humedad y se dan estos productos, además se dedican a la crianza de animales de corral.

Mayra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja y crianza de pollos y chanchos Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes y en el Recinto Matilde Esther.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y cacao y para alimento como balanceado para los animales. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta el carnaval ya que en esta fecha se reune la familia.
texts.en:
Mayra Carmen is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has 5 children.

The “WORKING FARMERS” cooperative bank can be found in the Matilde Esther area, belonging to the canton of Chillanes.  This cooperative has 11 members, and dedicates itself to short-cycle agricultural labors such as planting corn, cacao, oranges and bananas.  This is a humid zone where these crops do well.  They also dedicate themselves to raising farm animals.

Mayra dedicates herself to farming, to the planting of cacao, coffee and oranges, and to raising chickens and pigs.  She buys her products in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month, and sells them at the market on Sundays in Chillanes and Matilde Esther.

She requested the loan to buy fertilizer, urea, liquid fertilizers, for the planting of the corn and cacao, and balanced feed for her animals.  The loan has helped her to augment her income for the family’s consumption and for investing.  Her dream is to buy some land to continue farming.

She enjoys the carnival because, on that date, her family gathers together.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for planting corn and cacao, and balanced feed for her farm animals.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,ella tambien vende leche y lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los pequeños negocios de agricultura y ganaderia.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y alimentos para los ganados.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues dedicating herself to the business of livestock and farming.  She also sells milk at the different markets that exist in the district of Anta.  By means of this business, the member helps her children get ahead.  She would like to expand and improve her small farming and livestock enterprises.  She requests a loan to buy milk and feed for the livestock.

The member is happy for the loan, and commits to making her installment payments.

loans.use: buy milk and feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 49 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Sebastian, su esposo desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el asentamiento humano Justicia Paz y Vida. Ella es optimista, a pesar de que se encuentra enferma y no puede caminar bien. Pues antes trabajaba en programas de limpieza de parques y jardines, construcción de veredas y pistas que promueve el gobierno, ahí percibía un sueldo mensual que le ayudaba a mantener su familia a la que quiere con mucho amor. Sabe que volverá a trabajar pues es una mujer luchadora y se está recuperando con éxito. Por el momento se mantiene con el negocio de venta de comida los días festivos en su casa, además de vender verdura al menudeo en el mercado de su ciudad. Por su parte su esposo trabaja como soldador en un taller de cerrajería, donde le pagan cada fin de semana. Pero como es una mujer hábil convenció a su esposo para que emprenda por él mismo un taller en su casa, donde pueda realizas lo que aprendió. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Felicita de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para el trabajo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Felicita is 49 and a hardworking woman. She lives with Sebastian, her husband of 25 years. They have 7 children, but only 4 of them live at home. They own their house, located in the Justicia Paz y Vida human settlement. 

She is an optimist, despite the fact that she is ill and cannot walk well. She used to work in park and garden cleaning programs and path and trail construction promoted by the government. From that work, she would receive a monthly salary that helped her support her family that she cares for and loves deeply. She knows that she will return to work; she is a fighter and is recovering successfully. For the moment, she supports herself by selling food out of her home on festival days, as well as selling vegetables in her city’s market. 

Her husband works as a welder in a locksmith’s shop, where they pay him at the end of every week. Since she is a skillful woman, she convinced her husband to work for himself in a shop in their home, where he can carry out the work he has learned. This is her second loan with MFP, and she hopes that they can achieve their plans through this collaboration. She commits to making her loan payments. In addition, she is thankful to be part of the association because all the members are responsible and united. Felicita will invest the loan in tools for her husband’s work.

loans.use: Purchase tools to help her husband's welding business

loans.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento las Unidas entrando a su 1er ciclo conformado por 10 integrantes que viven en la zona de la Guardia, cuentan con negocio y actividad.
 La presidenta es la Sra. Jannel de edad de 18  años vive en la zona  hace 4 años, su  actividad es la venta de ropa  en su mismo domicilio también ofrece a distintas instituciones, y aprovecha para ofrecer en la universidad, Ya que ella estudia por las noches y en la mañana ofrece sus productos, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, responsable ya que tiene que dedicarse a su negocio y sus estudios, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería ropa de temporada por cantidad, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brinda para salir adelante ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica para mantener sus gastos personales y de estudios. 
                                                                                                                                                                                     .
texts.en:
The community bank Las Unidas is entering into it's first loan cycle. There are 10 members and they live in the La Guardia area. They run various businesses. 
The president is Jannel, who is 18 years old and has lived in the area for 4 years. She works selling clothes from her home and also to various institutions including the university. She studies at night and sells her products in the morning. She is a very hardworking and responsible young person as she works at both her business and her studies. She will use the money from the loan to buy seasonal clothing in bulk. She feels very grateful for the micro loan institution for the support that it has offered her to help her be successful as this is the first activity she has taken on to cover her personal expenses and studies. 

                                                                                                                                                                                     .

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 42-year-old married man, the father of two children and the owner of a bookstore for 11 years. He is a hardworking man who works in more than one domain to cover his family's expenses. Mounir has a bookstore where he sells almost all stationery requested by any student, while at the same time he sells toys, video games, perfumes, cosmetics and many other accessories. This wide variety of products at the same place assures their turnover.

Mounir is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to start a new business. He wants to trade in electric household appliances. He has already experienced Al Majmoua loans with one paid back loan, and he describes it as a unique one and hopes this loan will give the same results. He said that all the things he is doing are for his family's sake, and he hopes his children will achieve the best education ever.

loans.use: To start a new business.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 26 years old, married, and has one child. He runs a retail shop and has been in the business for the last six years, earning a monthly profit of about Kes 25,000. 

He was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer, and he is applying for his fourth loan of Kes 50,000, which he intends to use to buy additional stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and Vaseline to sell. He will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for his children. 

In future, the client hopes to grow his business into a well stocked supermarket.

loans.use: To buy stock for his shop.

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: El señor Luis , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es poder diversificar el cultivo y obtener mejor ingresos para construir su vivienda y vivir dignamente , don Luis enfrento un gran problema con su cultivo debido a la invasión de unas vacas de su vecino , logrando comerse gran parte del cultivo y este no hacerse responsables de los hechos , esto se produjo debido a que por falta de ingresos no hay barreras de protección para el mismo , el necesita que se le financie para poder comprar unos mil hijos de piña , fertilizantes e insumos para restablecer todo lo perdido .
texts.en: Sr. Luis lives with his family in the rural town of Ticuantepe.  His plans for the future are to grow a wider range of crops so that he can earn more and build a house.  Don Luis suffered a difficult loss when cattle belonging to a neighbor invaded his fields and ate a large part of his crop, a loss his neighbor has refused to take responsibility for.  He could have avoided the loss if he'd had a fence, but he didn't have the money to build one before.  He is applying for a loan to buy a thousand seedlings for his pineapple crop, along with the fertilizers and other supplies he needs to cover his loss.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y tambien el socio sigue trabajando en construccion civil,el socio los ganados los hace engordar y crecer y luego los hace los vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,el sueño del socio es mejorar el negocio de ganaderia.El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los ganados.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Our member continues to work a construction job and, at the same time, operate his livestock business.  He fattens his cattle until they're ready for sale, then sells them at one of the markets in the district of Anta.  His goal is to grow and improve his livestock business.  He is applying for a loan to buy feed for his cattle.  He is grateful for your support and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed for his livestock business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y tambien vende leche,la socia tambien tiene un terreno donde cultiva papa y maiz,en el negocio de la ganaderia la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia y agricultura.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construccion para que construya establos para las vacas.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member is still operating her farming business.  She grows potatoes and maize on the land that she owns, raises cattle and sells milk.  She fattens the cattle until they're ready for sale, then sells then in one of the markets in the district of Anta.  Her goal is to expand her farming business.  She is applying for a loan to buy construction materials for a new cowshed.  
She is grateful for your support and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to build a cowshed for her farming business.

loans.name: Francisco Wilberto

texts.es: El señor Wilberto, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia , los planes futuros hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que por muchos años a luchado por mejorar su humilde vivienda , El se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva , ya que siendo una persona de escasos recursos le brinda confianza . Don Wilberto tiene varios años de laborar para una empresa privada , pero su salario no le ajusta para comprar materiales de construcción de una sola vez , ya que en estos momentos quiere realizar un pequeño muro de sus vivienda , por problemas que en tiempo de lluvia se inunda y todas las corriente se pasa sobre el cerco llegando hasta la vivienda y eso le perjudica grandemente .
texts.en:
Wilberto lives with his family in the Ticuantepe municipality.  The future plan he has for his family is to help improve the conditions of their life given that, for many years, he has struggled to make their humble home better.  He feels very content for the support that Afodenic provides by means of the Kiva funds because, being a person of scarce resources, these bring him confidence.

Wilberto has worked for a private enterprise for several years, but his salary does not stretch for the purchase of construction materials.  At this time, he would like to add a small wall to his home because during rainy times it floods.  All the currents run past the fence up to the house, and this is greatly detrimental to him.

loans.use: buy stones, cement, iron and sand.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 29-year-old single man. He is smart, talented and energetic. Hassan started his new business two years ago. He used to work as a car mechanic, but he didn't like it at all, so he bought a school bus and started transporting students.

With his earned income, Hassan has saved money to buy another bus to expand his business. However, he needs to borrow a small amount of money to buy the additional school bus.

With the help of Al Majmoua (Kiva partner), Hassan will be capable of paying for the second bus and he will be able to continue expanding his business.

Hassan's good reputation helps him a lot in improving his business and gaining his customers' trust. He is working hard to open a big school bus chain in the future.

loans.use: To pay what's left from the price of his second school bus.

loans.name: Doris Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Doris, tiene 45 años esta casada, tiene 2 hijos (25 y 30 años), reside en la comunidad de la Pradera (las Torres) ubicada en el municipio de San Pedro Sula.
Su esposo se dedica a la pintura automotriz; sus hijos están casados, su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por su esposo y un sobrino al cual apoya con la crianza y estudio.
Hace 3 años inicio su negocio, el cual consiste en la venta ambulante de alimentos (de Pastelitos de carne y arroz), la comercialización la realiza a través de 4 personas que ha contratado como empleados de su negocio a los que les paga un salario semanal. 
Doña Doris es muy emprendedora y espera continuar creciendo en las ventas, lo cual considera de mucho provecho por las ganancias que le generan y además contribuye empleando a mas personas en la distribución de su producto. Ella espera dejar un buen record crediticio con la institución.
texts.en:
Doris, age 45, is married and has two children (ages 25 and 30).  She lives in the La Pradera (Las Torres) community in the San Pedro Sula municipality.

Her husband devotes himself to painting automobiles.  Her children are married.  Her family unit is comprised of her husband and a nephew whom she supports with his education and by raising him.

She started her business three years ago.  She sells food (meat and rice cakes) in an itinerant manner.  She sells them through four people she has contracted as employees of her business.  She pays them a weekly salary.

Doris is very enterprising, and she expects her sales to continue to grow.  She considers this to be very beneficial because of the earnings that are generated for her and for providing employment to people to distribute her product.  She expects to leave a good credit record with the institution.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for a house improvement project.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es: Calixto, de 60 años de edad; vive con su esposa Irene de 55 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 04 hijos  y juntos residen en su propia casa donde reina la comprensión. Calixto, aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, pero hace 30 años cuenta con su propio terreno donde tiene cultivos de cacao. Con la creatividad y las ganas de salir adelante, sus plantas están trabajadas ya que lo realiza con mucho esmero. Su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del cacao por la calidad del producto que los ofrece y fruto de ello percibe buenos réditos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola, de esa manera pueda seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes, y por ende mejorar su condición de vida. Este será el crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente contento por la confianza y apoyo que le dan porque gracias a ello podrá seguir con sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal agradece por permitirles ser parte de ello y se compromete en pagar puntual sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos,  contratando a jornaleros  para que le apoyen en las cosechas y desmonte de malezas.
texts.en: Calixto, 60, and his wife, Irene, 55, have 4 children.  They live in their own house where the family rule is mutual help and understanding.  Even as a boy, Calixto worked hard, helping his parents on their farm, but for the past 30 years he has made a living farming his own land, growing cacao.  His creativity and drive to get ahead have paid off.  His cacao beans are especially valued for their quality and bring him a good living.  He can normally operate the farm alone but he has to hire day laborers to help him harvest his crop.  The extra help allows him to bring the crop in faster and ensures a better yield.  For the future, he wants to continue expanding production so that he can meet demand from his customers and improve his quality of life.  This will be Calixto's first MFP loan.  He is grateful for your support and confidence because your loan will allow him to proceed with his plans for the business.   He thanks his community bank for their support, as well, and says that he is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  He will use the 1,500 new soles loan to hire day laborers to help him harvest his crop and clear his fields of weeds.

loans.use: to hire day laborers for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to order false hair, body cream, body spray, and hair relaxer.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 43-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and four children. He provides the main source of income in his family and works really hard to provide a better future for his children. 

He started his own metal trade in 2004 and wants to grow up his business.  Today, he is asking for a $1600 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional metal supplies.  He notes that this kiva loan will increase his profits by 20%.  In the future, he plans to expand his business and open his own metal shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional metal supplies.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one working sibling. In addition to Ali, all the family members are working together to be able to enhance their way of living. Ali started his own business as a taxi driver in 2010, and is looking forward to gaining more clients. He’s good and friendly and that makes people loyal to him. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen S.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his car. He’s sure that this will improve his business and therefore increase his revenues.  In the future, he plans to buy a van to be able to serve a wider range of people.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. 

He is a truck mechanic and works nonstop to offer a worthy and respectable life to his family.  

Today, he requests to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools that will help him improve his business and efficiency.  In the future, he plans to open his own garage.

loans.use: to purchase new tools that will help him improve his business.

loans.name: Hardretha

texts.en:
Hardretha lives in Paynesville, is 40 years old and married with four children between five and  to 23 years old.  All are in school and live at home.

For the past eight years Hardretha has been run a crushes rock business.  She started this business with a small amount of money from her husband.  Herdther says she enjoy the buying process and making a profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more crush rock to enlarge her business.  Eventually, Hardretha plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more crush rock.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 30-year-old single man who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Francis has operated a retail shop for the past 6 years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 loan, he wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale.  He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He’s trying as best he can to support his family and offer them a good way of living. He has been working as a car painter since the year 2000. He has his own garage and a fair number of loyal customers as well. In parallel, he works as an independent taxi driver upon request. 

Today, he’s asking to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanic tools and painting supplies for his business. This will keep him up-to-date and allow him to present new paint colors to his customers. In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage in order to serve more people.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanic's tools and painting supplies for his business.

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en: Sleiman is a 27-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children.  Because of the high living expenses, Sleiman was obliged to work hard in order to cover their needs. He has twelve years of experience in the agriculture field, until he decided to have his own land in 2004 where he cultivates all kinds of fruits and vegetables.  Today, he needs to borrow $2,300 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L. to purchase new agricultural supplies in addition to fertilizers and seeds.  This will certainly boost his productivity and thus his revenues.  In the future, he plans to open his own fruit and vegetable shop.

loans.use: to purchase new agricultural supplies in addition to fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Jeerling Raquel

texts.es: La Señora  Jeerling , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia , su esposo labora por cuanta propia para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que tienen un hijo de diez años que estudia su primaria , doña Jeerling labora en una empresa privada desde hace muchos años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida . Ella necesita un financiamiento ya que quiere cambiar el techo de la casa, ya que este esta muy deteriorado y en tiempos de lluvia parece un pazcón lo cual que se le están dañando los pocos electrodoméstico que con mucho esfuerzo a  logrado comprar.El préstamo lo va invertir en Zinc, perlines, cemento , entre otros .
texts.en:
This lady, Jeerling, lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her family. Her husband is self-employed and works to contribute to the household expenses, as they have a ten year old son who is studying at primary school. Jeerling has been working for a private company for many years, and her plan for her family is to improve their living conditions. 

Jeerling requires this loan because she wants to change the roof of their house, as it has deteriorated a lot and in wet weather it acts like a strainer which damages the few electrical appliances that she painstakingly managed to buy. This loan will be invested in the purchase of zinc, beams and cement, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, beams, stones and cement, among other items.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children who are students. 

Unlike many other women, she helps cover their family's financial expenses.  She strives to work really hard and don’t hesitate to offer help whenever it is needed.   She has owned a mini-market since 1996.  She succeeds because she is very welcoming and friendly. 

Today, Amale wants to borrow $3000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate her mini-market.  In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to renovate her mini-market.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is applying for another loan to expand her milk-selling business. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to purchase more packets of milk to resell. In the future, Lucy aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Lucy has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more packets of milk to resell.

loans.name: Zulma  Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zulma tiene 26 años  de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 9 años que estudia, ella vive con sus padres e hija en la Colonia Esquipulas de San Pedro Sula.
Zulma se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la cual vende en el mercado local de la ciudad, ofrece ropa interior, jeans, blusas y camisetas, para caballeros y damas. Ella logro establecer hace un año y medio este negocio el cual le ha generado buenas ganancias, le dedica 8 horas diarias.
Ha logrado mantener su negocio con préstamos y reinvirtiendo las ganancias.  Actualmente solicita un préstamo de 12,000 lempiras, para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería como ropa interior, jeans, blusas y camisetas. 
Su meta es mantener el negocio surtido y con las ganancias que obtenga desea comprar productos de la canasta básica para vender y así aumentar sus ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Zulma, age 26, is a single mother.  She has a nine year old daughter who goes to school.  She lives with her parents and her daughter in the Colonia Esquipulas in San Pedro Sula.

Zulma sells clothes at the local city market.  She sells underwear, jeans, blouses, and t-shirts for men and women.  She managed to establish this business one and a half years ago.  It has generated good income for her.  She works eight hours a day.

She has managed to maintain her business with loans and by reinvesting the earnings.  She is currently requesting a loan for 12,000 lempiras to buy merchandise like underwear, jeans, blouses, and t-shirts.

Her goal is to keep her business stocked.  With the earnings that she gets she wishes to buy basic food staples to sell.  This will increase her income in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy underwear, jeans, blouses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a abse de maiz y ahora tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la chicha . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maiz para preparar la chicha y tambien para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Primitiva, continues to sell 'chicha', a corn-based beverage. She also now has a grocery store selling staples such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, and her business gives her the means to bring up her children. 

Her dream is to have her own premises where she can sell her chicha. She has requested this loan to purchase corn for preparing chicha, and also to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil to stock the grocery store.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Primitiva is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase corn for preparing chicha, and to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Josefina Isabel

texts.es: Josefina con su anterior credikiva compró calzado, ropa , cosméticos y víveres para  preparar las comidas que vendió en el  restaurante . Ahora se prepara para las navidades y el año nuevo, haciendo un buen surtido de mercancías para exhibir en su miscelánea y también comprará insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos en el restaurante. Su inversión planea ser todo un éxito porque la hace sobre los pedidos y porque preparará pasteles en un importante volumen que tien encargados y que son justamente el alimento que mas consumen las familias en las fiestas del fin de año. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: Estoy muy agradecida, es la segunda vez que me apoyan, espero lo continúen haciendo .”
texts.en: Josefina used her last Kiva loan to pay for merchandise--footwear, clothing, cosmetics, etc.--for her retail business and supplies for her food business.  She's been stocking her businesses for Christmas and New Year's and she has to pay for more merchandise for the retail business and extra suppplies for her food business.  She expects the investment to be a success because she has a lot of orders for her cakes and cakes are among the food most wanted at the holidays here.  Her messages for Kiva lenders is this: "I am very grateful that you have decided to support my businesses a second time and I hope you will continue to help in the future".

loans.use: to pay for merchandise that she will resell and supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has three children ages 4, 8 and 10.  He has two additional dependents, who live with him, who assist with house chores.  

In 1996, Mohamed established his provisions business to become self-reliant and to take great care of his household.  Working daily and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month.  

He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to pay for provisions.

Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000.
