In the future, Mohamed plans to expand his shop from a kiosk to a concrete structure, to see that his business grow so he can take even better care of his family.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 8 children, one of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  

Teopista has a food stall business selling charcoal and bananas.  She has been in this business for 7 years and works 7 days a week. Teopista sells her products at the market, by means of retail.     

Teopista has requested a loan of 1500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas.  The main business challenges for Teopista include seasonality, defaulters and thieves.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to own a her own house.  Teopista lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, one of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grand children).  

Harriet has a tailoring business.  She's been in this business for over 10 years and works 7 days a week.  Harriet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Harriet has requested a loan of 1500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing and threads.   She also generates additional income through rental.  The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality, defaulters and thieves.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start a tailoring school and to build more rental rooms.  Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing and threads.

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en: Fawzi is a 63-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and living with his wife. During his life, he was the one taking care of his family and he still is. He has owned a car wash shop since 1996. He provides his customers with good service in order to build an excellent relationship with them.  Today, he’s asking for a loan of $2700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added cleaning products for his business. He notes that this will improve his work therefore his returns. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans, develop his business, and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to purchase added cleaning products for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a separate space to launch her own mini market and increase the variety of products.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a handyman – he has the know-how to install equipment from security cameras to satellites – and also has the skills to sell these services for his business. He works primarily in Hialeah, Florida, providing his installation services in offices and homes. Additionally, Juan provides consultation services to clients. 

Juan’s business is home-based as his projects are always on-site. Juan is looking for a loan to purchase inventory and stock for upcoming projects.  With access to additional capital, Juan will be able to expand his business by offering services outside of his community in Hialeah, Florida.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and stock for upcoming projects.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida y tambien ahora tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche,aceite para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mauricia continues to operate her food selling business and now, in addition, she has a small grocery store selling products of primary necessity such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. With the store's earnings, Mauricia advances her children. Her dream is to expand her grocery store.

Mauricia is happy about the loan and is committed to complying with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 45-year-old married man living in Mafraq with his wife and his three children. 

Amer has a music store selling and renting movies and music records in addition to renting VCRs and DVD players.

He also has DJ’s equipment that he rents, especially at weddings season and summer time. 

He has created a good list of loyal customers.

Amer would like to get a loan to improve his store and buy new, efficient equipment that will help keep his good reputation and enhance it and enable him to satisfy more customers all at once, especially in busy seasons.

loans.use: to improve his store and buy new, efficient equipment.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane  vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et est  âgé de 46 ans. Il exerce l’activité de commerçant  depuis plus de 10 ans et vend des articles de mercerie dans un marché de la localité.Il a choisi cette activité a cause de sa rentabilité. Ce qui est plus  important pour lui c’est d’accumuler des bénéfices. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2004. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs destiné a l’achat de garnitures et de fournitures de filage  a revendre. Son objectif est d’accroitre es bénéfices et augmenter son fond de  roulement.
texts.en: Mr. Ousmane lives in Senegal.  He is 46 years old and single.   He has been working as a merchant for more than 10 years, selling sewing supplies at the market in his area.  He chose this type of work because of its profitability.  The most important thing for him is to earn money.  He has been a member of l’U-IMCEC since August, 2004.  He is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs in order to buy decorative accessories and supplies for spinning wool.  His goal is to increase his profits and his working capital.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies for resale.

loans.name: Begg Thierno Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 10/12/2010. IL est composé de 11 femmes du même village. Elles sont issues de la même localité et se sont constituées par voisinage et par affinité.

Khady est responsable du groupement, elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 04 enfants. 

Elle a pour activité principale le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises (produits cosmétiques) pour le développement de son activité et aussi pour satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle va soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on October 12, 2010.  It is made up of eleven women from the same village.  They come from the same area and know each other as neighbors and are connected through their interests. 

Khady is the leader of the group.  She is 54 year old. She is married and the mother of four children.

She is in the business of selling cosmetic products.  She has good experience for this type of work because she has been at it for several years.  

Her loan will allow her to stock up on merchandise (cosmetic products) for her work and to meet the demand of her customers. 

With her profits she will assist her husband in meeting family responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 43-year-old entrepreneur who lives in a modest house with his wife, Yohana, 40 years old, his father and three children: Viona, 9 years old and attending Elementary School grade 4; Arson, 4 years old and Viola, one and a half years old.  

In order to generate income for his family, Daniel runs a business selling fish and broilers. He sells fish in the morning from one house to another, whereas in the afternoon he sells broilers using a cart. The income he earns is spent to fulfill the needs of the family, buy medicine for his father and pay the school expenses of Viola. 

Daniel dreams of improving his broiler business as the business has a good opportunity in the future. He plans to purchase more chicks and feed but he needs more money to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000. This loan will be spent on two boxes of chicks and feed for them. Daniel is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman; Jordan and a mother of four children. She has a home-based project in which she makes bakery goods and other kinds of foods.

Hanan is looking to open a shop for her business so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making pastries and other foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of clothing.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is applying for another loan to expand her charcoal selling business. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. In the future, Maimuna aspires to improve her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Maimuna has greatly improved her family’s standard of living.  She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Swagira

texts.en:
Swagira lives in city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother).  

Swagira sells second hand clothes.  She has been in business for over 10 years and works 7 days a week.  Swagira sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Swagira has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenges for Swagira include seasonality and increasing prices of used clothes.  Her goals and aspirations are to sell wholesale and to build more her own house.  

Swagira lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is applying for another loan to expand her clothes selling business.  She will use this 10,000 Kes loan to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale.  In the future, Khaled aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Khaled has greatly improved her family’s standard of living.  She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina, de 28 años de edad, casada, su esposo realiza trabajos de albañilería, tiene una hija de 4 años de edad, vive en Col. Lomas del  Carmen San Pedro Sula.
Evangelina, es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene 2 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de jugos naturales  y comida como pan cake o fritas de harina, avena con leche y café. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, transportándola en una carreta de mano. Ella aprovecha a vender durante la mañana para el desayuno todos los días. Se  ubica en puntos estratégicos de venta.
Esta solicitando L.5,000.00 para invertirlo en el negocio, ella va comprar insumos como frutas, azúcar, harina, café, leche, avena y otros, para la elaboración de comida y jugos. Ella tiene como meta ahorrar de sus ganancias para comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Evangelina is 28 years old and married.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  She has a four year old daughter, and she lives in the Colonia Lomas del Carmen in San Pedro Sula.

Evangelina is a very enterprising person.  She has had her own business for two years.  She sells natural juices and food like pancakes or fritters, oatmeal with milk, and coffee.  She sells in an itinerant manner, transporting the food in a handcart.  She makes the most of the morning to sell breakfast every day.  She locates herself in strategic selling spots.

She is requesting 5,000 lempira to invest in her business by purchasing supplies like fruit, sugar, flour, coffee, milk, oatmeal, and others to make food and juices.  Her goal is to save her income to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, flour, coffee, milk, oatmeal, and bread.

location.town: Col. Lomas del Carmen, San Pedro Sula.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionicio de 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa Irene de 38 años de edad; viven en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos, Daniel de 16 años y Rafael de 03 años a quienes desea brindarles un buen futuro. Dionicio, aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres y a la vez trabajaba como jornalero en distintas chacras. Con sus ahorros acumulados compró su propio terreno donde viene trabajando 10 años de manera independiente y cuenta con cultivos de cacao y café.  Su producto más rentable es el cultivo de cacao, porque los vende a un buen precio. Los meses de Junio a Agosto son tiempos donde mayormente se siembra todo tipo de plantas, razón por la cual Dionicio acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar sus prestamos y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos sembrar más plantas de cacao. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo mas espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente alegre al saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero para seguir con sus planes de trabajo, asimismo, se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Agradece a su banco comunal por permitirle ser parte de ello. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
44-year-old Dionicio lives with his wife Irene, 38, in their own house. They have two sons - Daniel is 16 and Rafael is three. Dionicio wants to provide a good future for them. 

Even as a teenager, Dionicio worked on his parents' land and at the same time as a day-laborer in various fields. With his accumulated savings he bought his own land, and for 10 years he has been working independently, producing cocoa and coffee. His most profitable product is the cultivation of cacao, because it sells for a good price. 

The months of June through to August are the times when most crops are sown, which is why Dionicio went to the financial institution to apply for his loans with the purpose of planting more cacao trees. The plans he has in mind are to continue planting and to acquire more land so that he can rise out of poverty. This loan will be his first with MFP, and Dionicio feels happy to know that he can receive financial support to continue with his work plans, and therefore he promises to comply with his repayments. 

He is grateful to his communal bank for letting him be part of this. With the 1,500 soles, he will be able to buy more cocoa trees.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa trees

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La socia continua trabajando en la misma institución privada, ella tambien continua con la elaboración de manualidades la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de materiales como por ejemplo telas, napa, cintas, globos, pintura, lana y mantas. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de los diferentes trabajos.
texts.en: This borrower continues to work for the same private institution. She is also still making handicrafts. She would like to invest the funds from the loan in buying materials such as fabric, stuffing, ribbons, balloons, wool and woven cloths. She would like to invest the loan in buying materials to make various kinds of handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy materials to make various kinds of handicrafts.

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es:
Baltazar, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, todos trabajan en el hogar, él administra una tienda de productos domésticos, este lo inicio junto a su esposa, está instalado en su propia casa lo atienden a tiempo completo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos, azúcar, entre otros productos que los clientes demandan, esta inversión le permitirá mejorar el negocio y espera que las ventas aumenten.
Él quiere ser un buen cliente, para trabajar de la mano con los préstamos y así mejorar la condición familiar.
texts.en:
Baltazar lives with his wife and children. They all work at home. He runs a household items store which he started with his wife. It is located in his house and he runs it full time. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase products like rice, beans, oil, eggs, and sugar, among other products that his customers want. This investment will allow him to improve his business and he hopes that his sales will increase. 

He wants to be a good client and work hand in hand with the loans. That way will improve his family's condition.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, eggs and sugar.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to operate her grocery store business. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Thanks to this business, she is helping her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil on a wholesale basis. 

The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to fulfilling her payment plan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité sop serigne fallou a été crée le 10/12/10 Il est composé de 16 femmes issues de la même localité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

NDIEYA, (debout à droite de la photo et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée mère de 03 d'enfants. 

Elle développe une activité de vente d'effets vestimentaire (bijoux, d'habits pour enfants et dames) Et comme activité parallèle elle vend des arachides 

Avec son prêt reçu, elle va financer son activité ci-dessus

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Fallou was created on October 12, 2010.  It is made up of sixteen women who come from the same area.  They all run small businesses. 

Ndieya (first on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the leader of the group.  She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three children.
  
She has developed a clothing business including jewelry and clothing for women and children.  In addition to this, she sells peanuts. 

She will finance her business activities with this loan.  

Her profits will allow her to assist her husband in meeting her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, clothing, shoes and peanuts.

loans.name: Tayour Aljana/ Abeer Group

texts.en:
The six members of the TAYOUR ALJANA/ ABEER group are mainly married women and are named Nour, Afrah, Khadijah, Rahmah, Wardah and Halimah. They are 32-50 years of age and have three to eight children each. All of them live a working-class neighborhood of the city of Aden (the economic capital of Yemen). Their community is in a rural area surrounded by the field with the clothes markets. and they have many clients, mostly women. The whole group took out a loan of 300,000 YER.

Nour, the coordinator of her group, is wearing a red veil ("hijab") and has a hand-bag in the photo. She is 50 years old. She has operated a business selling fabrics, veils, scarfs and various clothes for twenty years. She will use her loan to purchase some clothing to sell to women. 

Nour`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB and, because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the reinvestment she makes from each loan. 

In the future, Nour would like to save her profit to start building her house.

loans.use: to purchase some clothing goods to sell to women.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 43-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Nawal is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old.  She is married to Jackson.  Together they have five school going children.  Agnes is a farmer and has been in business for the past eleven years.

This is her second term loan in KADET LTD.  She will use the whole loan amount to pay school fees for her children.  Her dream is to expand her business and make more profit to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en:
Tufa is applying for another loan to expand her existing business.  She will use this 20,000 Kes loan to purchase more stocks of flavors and bags for packaging juice. In the future, Tufa aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Tufa has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of flavors and bags for packaging juice.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old, married to Ndolo and they have three children.  She has been running a hotel business for the last 10 years.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD of Kes 20,000.  She will use the loan to purchase cooking oil, maize and wheat flour, sugar and rice. 

With the anticipated profits, she will educate her children and grow her business. Her hopes and dreams are to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize and wheat flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add more stock of food in her shop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 52 años es una mujer ejemplar. Cuidó de sus dos hijos: Cesar y Andre por si sola, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. Ella realiza varias actividades, pues es una mujer luchadora con iniciativa y ganas de salir adelante. Durante las mañanas trabaja en una casa, donde cocina y limpia, ahí le pagan un sueldo mensual, ya por las tardes se dedica a supervisar la maderera que alquila a unos señores, quienes le pagan de manera mensual. Pero como el terreno fue heredado para su hermano y ella, dividen las ganancias de manera equitativa. Ya por las noches cuida el mercado de su localidad, donde los propietarios le pagan por sus servicios. De esta manera ella, obtiene su sustento económico, sobre todo para pagar la universidad de sus 2 únicos hijos quienes estudian Derecho y ciencias políticas en una institución privada. “sacar profesionales a mis hijos es lo que más deseo”, comenta.  Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Yolanda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 52, is an exemplary woman. She raised her two sons, Cesar and Andre, by herself in her own home, located in the town of El Tambo. She is a fighter, driven to get ahead in life. 

She works at several jobs. In the mornings, she works at a house where she cooks and cleans. From that, she is paid a monthly salary. In the afternoons she supervises the lumber mill that she rents to some people who pay her on a monthly basis. Since the land was inherited by both her and her brother, they divide the earnings equally. In the evenings, she takes care of the market in her town, where the owners pay her for her services. These activities allow her to earn a living, and above all, pay for the university education of her two sons, who study law and political science in a private institution. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she hopes that through her collaboration with MFP, she can realize her plans. She is committed to making her loan payments. In addition, she is thankful to be a part of the association because all of the members are responsible and unified. Yolanda will invest her loan in her children’s studies.

loans.use: invest in the eduction of her children

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristo Rey Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Cristo Rey, está formado por 9 emprendedoras que se unieron desde hace tiempo para formar este grupo. Este Banco Comunal, ya son clientes de Fundación León 2000, desde hace mucho tiempo y han demostrado ser personas responsable y con buenos principios y con un record crediticio excelente. Natividad del Socorro tiene 54 años de edad, y se dedica al destace de cerdos en lo cual ya tienen varios clientes que le ofrece, ella actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
The 'Cristo Rey' communal bank consists of 9 entrepreneurs who joined together long ago to form this group. This communal bank has been a customer of Fundación Leon 2000 for many years, and they have proven themselves to be responsible people with good principles, and with an excellent credit record. 

Natividad del Socorro is 54 years old, and is a pig butcher. She already has several customers that she serves, and she is currently seeking a loan to invest in her business and in the purchase of pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children; one of them is still attending school and the two others are working. He’s a hard worker depending on himself in order to earn money and build a good future for his family. He opened his own mini-market in the year 2000. He knows very well how to select his products and serve his customers as well as it should be. 

Today, he wants to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added goods such as soft drinks, sugar, cigarettes and many other items for his business to increase his sales and therefore his profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans in order to renovate and improve his mini-market.

loans.use: to buy added goods such as soft drinks, sugar, cigarettes and many other items.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 30 years old, married to Simon, and they have two children. She has been selling clothes for the last 10 years earning a monthly income KES. 5,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD of KES 25,000. She intends to use the funds to purchase additional stocks of clothes. 


With the anticipated profits she will increase the minimum stock level of her business. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business to a clothes wholesale store.

loans.use: To purchase stock of  clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: La socia continua laborando en la misma institución; y paralelamente a esto ella administra su pequeña librería, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de mercaderia como papel a-4 por millares, lapiceros, plumones, borradores, tintas para computadoras, cds entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia para implementar el negocio.
texts.en:
This member, María, still works at the same institution and also manages her small bookstore. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise such as A4 paper in bulk, pens, markers, erasers, ink, computers, and CDs among other items. 

María is requesting this new loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise, for building up her business.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise for use in her business.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Pablo , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de San Caralampio , habita junto a su familia , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que por cenizas del volcán todo el cultivo de cítricos se quemo, ahora el cuenta con el cultivo de café , ya que este rubro esta siendo muy demandado en el mercado , pero no cuenta con los ingresos necesarios para poder darle en mantenimiento adecuado que necesita la producción , para el es muy deprimente ya que la agricultura es la fuente de ingresos para su familia y si este no lo aprovecha se vera en serios problemas económicos para sustentar la alimentación de toda su familia .
texts.en: Pablo is a humble farmer in the area of San Caralampio. He lives with his family and the biggest difficulty he has is the volcanic ash that burned his whole citrus crop. Now he has a coffee crop, since it is in high demand in the market. He doesn't have enough income to be able to to sufficient maintenance for production. It is very depressing for him, since farming is his family's source of income and if he doesn't take advantage of this, he will be in serious financial problems to support his whole family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and materials.

loans.name: Arnak

texts.en: Arnak is a 42-year-old farmer from Lukashin village. He lives with his wife and sons. The family gets its main income from land cultivation. Arnak needs some financial investments to  purchase fertilizer for the land. This will allow Arnak to gather a good harvest and get additional income from its sale. Arnak will put aside savings and purchase agricultural machines in the future.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer.

loans.name: Sop Absa Diakhate Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sokhna Absa Diakhaté a été crée le 21 septembre le jour du 1er financement du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 07 femmes issue de la même localité qui sont unies par des liens d’amitié de voisinage. Elles exercent la même activité (le petit commerce) 

Astou (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe.Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants et une petite soeur. 

Elle gère une petite cantine ou elle vend des condiments (piment, ail, poivre) elle est aussi détentrice d'un réfrigérateur qui lui permet de fabriquer et vendre de la crème glace. 

Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en achetant la marchandise ci-dessus pour revendre dans sa localité. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son frère dans la gestion de la famille et de renforcer son épargne dans le Banc Vvillageois
texts.en:
The Sop Sokhna Absa Diakhaté solidarity group was set up on 21st September, the day of their first loan from the Banc Villageois. The group is made up of seven women from the same town, who got together through friendship or as neighbors. They carry out the same activities (small businesses).

Astou (standing on the right of the photo) is in charge of the group. She is 39 years old, married and mother to three children, and she has a younger sister. She has a small shack where she sells condiments (chili peppers, garlic, pepper) and she also has a refridgerator which enables her to make and sell ice-cream.

With the loan she has received, she is going to increase her supplies, by buying the goods mentioned above in order to resell them in her town.

Her profits will allow her to help out her brother with the management of the family and to boost her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy condiments (chili peppers, pepper, garlic), sugar and other items

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora; vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Valerio de 33 años y su hija Heidy de 06 años a quien desean brindarle un buen futuro. Donatilda, lucha por sobresalir adelante con su puesto de trabajo. Ella es comerciante y tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en su comunidad. La tienda de Donatilda es muy frecuentado por sus compradores porque ella las atiende con mucha cordialidad. Apertura las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. 
Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias ampliando su puesto de ventas. Este será su préstamo número 02 con MFP y se siente muy contenta al saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para que así pueda seguir con su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por ser una persona responsable. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más víveres para su negocio.
texts.en:
Donatilda is 29 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her spouse, Valerio, who is 33 years old, and her daughter Heidy, who 6. She wants to offer her a good future. Donatilda fights to get ahead at her work. She is a merchant and has a produce store located in her community. Donatilda's store is frequented a lot buy buyers because she serves them very cordially. She opens her doors very early and is ready to receive her first buyers, who, knowing the variety of merchandise that her store has, don't hesitate to buy from her. What she likes the most about her job is talking to customers, since this is one of her abilities she uses to gain more consumers. She has been in this business for 10 years and considers the most difficult thing to be standing almost all day long.
 
Over time, she plans on increasing her earnings by expanding her store. This will be her second loan with MFP and she is very happy knowing that she will have financial support to be able to continue doing her job. She is well liked in her communal bank because she is a responsible person. With the  1,500 nuevos soles, she can buy more produce for her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a twenty-eight-year-old gentleman from Kisumu city and is married with two children.

George operates a motorcycle transport business in Kisumu town, a business he has done for the last four years, making a monthly income of Kes 20,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy another motorcycle. He plans to use his profits to educate and feed his children.

His dream is to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 37 years old. She is married to Charles, a farmer.Together they have five school-going children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past nine years.She gets a monthly income of KES 18,000 from the business.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loan well. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seeds and also purchase a heifer. Her dream is to improve her horticultural and dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 29-year-old gentleman from Kisumu town and is married to Millicent and they have 2 children.

Christopher operates a retail shop at the populous open air market of Kibuye. He has been in this business for the last two years, making a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking fat. He will use his profits to open a business for his wife.

His dream is to have a big retail shop.

loans.use: to add more stocks of sugar, rice, cooking fat and flour

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-five-year-old lady from Kisumu City, in the West of Kenya, and is married to Sospeter, a driver. They have four children aged between 12-16 years.

Mary operates a fish-selling business in Kisumu town, a business she has done for the last seven years, making a monthly income of Kes 40,000. She is taking a first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy fresh fish for sale. She will use her profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land and built a family house.

loans.use: To add more stock of fresh fish.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children who are enrolled in school. Her husband Philip is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Mariam owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mariam has operated a business of selling fried potatoes for the past 2 years. Her potential clients are local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the 15,000 KES, she wants to purchase more sacks of potatoes for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of potatoes for her business

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is 45 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 27 and 25. In 1997, she established her milk-selling business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 8 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Carmen Victoria

texts.es: Carmen de 52 años vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos de 30 y 32 años. Ellos están ubicados  al sur de la ciudad, en un barrio que combina comercio formal e informal, zonas recreativas, casas de familia, conjuntos de apartamentos y es muy especial para los Colombianos, porque tiene el Estadio Metropolitano, uno de los escenarios mas importantes del futbol profesional de Colombia, llamado también la casa del Junior, el equipo amado de la Costa Caribe. En este ambiente Carmen tiene un negocio, mediante el cual vende medicamentos, papelería, mercancía variada y ofrece el servicio de llamadas a celulares.  Negocio que inició en el año 2008 después de tener la experiencia de vender ropa durante mas de 30 años. El funcionamiento es de lunes a domingos en un horario extendido de 7:00 am a 10:00 p.m con una competencia que favorece el crecimiento de su clientela potencial, que reconoce que maneja muy buenos precios en su oferta y un servicio inigualable. Su expectativa de crecimiento la hace pensar en la necesidad de capital de trabajo, para poder comprar en mayor volumen y ganar descuentos, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa interior que tiene encargada, útiles escolares y una vitrina. Su inversión tendrá éxito por que la hace soportada en pedidos de sus clientes, porque comprará con descuentos especiales de la temporada y porque la hace en la época en que la necesitan los consumidores, aquí es donde se nota la gran experiencia comercial que tiene Carmen.
texts.en:
52-year old Carmen lives with her husband and two children aged 30 and 32 in the south part of the city. It’s a neighbourhood where formal businesses are mixed in with informal businesses, recreational areas, family homes, and apartments. Most importantly for Colombians, it contains the Metropolitan Stadium, one of the most important places for professional football in the country. It’s the home of Junior, a much-loved team from the Caribbean coast.

This is where Carmen has her business. She sells medicines, stationery, and various other items as well as offering cellular phone service. She began this business in 2008 after selling clothes for over thirty years. The store is open seven days a week from 7am to 10pm. These long hours are very competitive and will result in many potential customers who recognize that Carmen offers very good prices and unequalled service. 

The anticipated growth of the business has made Carmen think of the need for more working capital so she can buy in greater volume and get discounted prices. As a result she has approached the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for her first loan. With the money she plans to buy underwear for which she has orders, school supplies, and a display case. This investment will bring success as it is backed by requests from her customers, she will buy at special seasonal prices, and because she will sell the items at the time when customers need them. It is easy to see that Carmen has lots of business experience.

loans.use: to buy underwear, school supplies, and a display case

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de venta de muebles y colchones, la socia esta creciendo con su negocio y ahora requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de muebles y colchones al por mayor y comprara de la fabrica y lo repartira  a sus clientes y otra parte ella lo vendera de forma independiente. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de colchones y muebles para la venta.
texts.en: This borrower is still working at her business selling furniture and mattresses. She is currently growing her business and now she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of furniture and mattresses in bulk. She will also buy fabric to distribute to her customers and also sell independently. She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of mattresses and furniture for resale.

loans.use: buy mattresses and furniture for sale

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a thirty-one-year-old man from Kisumu city, situated in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Adhiambo and they have two children aged 5 and 8 years.

Lawrence operates a tent- and chair-hiring business in Kisumu, a business he has done for the last year, making a monthly income of Kes 25,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more plastic seats and tents for the business. He will plow profits back into the business.

His dream is to have a big chair- and tent-hire business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tents to hire out.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Hellen has operated a dried fish selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Alie is a 43-year-old married woman with 1 child who is enrolled in school. Her husband Yusuf is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Alie owns a house with electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

Alie has operated a juice-selling business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a water-selling business.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase pipes, a tank, and pay for water connection for her new water-selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pipes, a tank and pay for water connection for her new water-selling business

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 40-year-old married man with 5 children who attend school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to fulfilling the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Omar has operated a battery charging business for the past 5 years; his potential clients are local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the KES 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase battery chargers for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase battery chargers for his business.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is a 40-year-old man from Lambwe town, Western Kenya and is married to Beatrice. They have four children between two and 25 years of age.

Clement operates a tomato farming business in Homabay.  He has been in this business for the last 11 years, making a monthly income of KES 4000. 

He is taking out his first loan, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizer. He will use his profits to buy farm implements and improve his home. His dream is to expand his business and diversify to other crops.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his tomato farm.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is a 46-year-old lady from the Shibale area of Kakamega town, Western Kenya. She is married with four children aged between 10 and 16 years.
Rodah operates a pharmacy in the Shibale area, a business she has run for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of 40,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from Kiva partner KADET, which she will use to buy more drugs for her pharmacy shop. She will plough the profits back into her business.
Rodah's dream is to have a sustainable business so that she is able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a cousin and her brother). 

Grace has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Grace sells her products at the market, retail. Grace has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, rice and cartons of salt.    
 
The main business challenges for Grace include transportation and increasing prices of commodities.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale and also to build her own house . Grace lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills,   and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap  and rice.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 40-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He is responsible for his family, which is why he works under pressure, and he’s more than happy about that. He has been working with aluminum for the past 20 years. Today, he is looking for a loan of $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new materials, such as aluminum, in order to improve his business and attract new customers. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment such as aluminum.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 40-year-old single mother with four children who attend school. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 
Lydia has operated a retail shop for the past three years. Her potential customers are local residents. Her major business challenge is transportation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.
With her loan of 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stocks of detergents, sugar, beans and rice for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of detergents, sugar, beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children in addition to his parents. He’s taking on his own family responsibilities and does not hesitate to show help whenever needed.  He had seven years of experience in selling electrical equipment, and then he decided to open his own electrical products shop in 2005. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan of $2800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of electrical products such as heaters, refrigerators and many other items in order to increase his sales and therefore his revenue. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop by adding diverse items to it.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of electrical products such as heaters, refrigerators and many other items.

loans.name: Bephine

texts.en:
Bephine is a 29-year-old single lady who lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for herself and house rent. 

Bephine has operated a second-hand clothes selling business for the past three years; her potential clients are local area residents. She faces a major challenge of cost of transport. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more bundles of used clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bundles of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es: Eudosia, es una mujer viuda de 62 años; vive en su propia casa junto a su única hija, Mercedes de 23 años a quien le da lo mejor para tener un buen futuro. Eudosia, es una mujer muy laboriosa, con su puesto de ventas trata de sobresalir adelante. Ella es comerciante y tiene un tienda de abarrotes situado en su comunidad. La bodega de Eudosia, es muy frecuentado por sus  vecinos ya que ella les brinda buen trato. Apertura las puertas de su negocio desde tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 25 años en éste negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para incrementar en su tienda. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente orgullosa de saber que contará con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir trabajando. Agradece a su banco comunal por permitirles trabajar y se compromete a ser responsable con los pagos de su cuota. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles,  comprará más víveres para incrementar en su tienda.
texts.en:
Eudosia is a 62 year old widow. She lives in her own home with her only daughter, Mercedes, who is 23 years old and whom she gives the best to provide her with a good future. Eudosia is a hard-working woman, working in sales and trying to get ahead. She is a saleswoman and has a general store in her community. Eudosia's store is frequented quite often by her neighbors because of the good service she provides.

She opens the doors of her business very early to be ready to receive her first customers. She knows the variety of products in her store leaves customers no doubt they will buy from her. What she most enjoys about her job is talking to her customers, and this is one of her skills she uses to gain more customers. She has worked at this business for 25 years and thinks the hardest thing about it is staying on her feet all day. She will use the loan to buy more goods to stock her store. This will be her first loan with MFP and she is proud to know she can count on the support of the lenders to keep working. She thanks her community bank for letting them work and promises to be responsible with her loan payments. With the 1,500 nuevos soles she will buy more goods to stock her store.

loans.use: buy more products for her store

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 52-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. Her father is the one responsible for covering the family expenses in addition to her. 

Despite her young age and unlike other people, Ibtisam has the ambition to have her own business. She opened her own international call center and internet shop in year 2000.

 Today, she’s asking for a loan of $2200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new phone and internet machine. This will boost her business thus her profits. In the future, she plans to take out more Kiva loans in order to improve her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a new phone and internet machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children who are all studying. He strives to work really hard to cover their expenses and enhance their way of living, especially since his family means everything to him. 

Ali opened his own mini-market in 2003 and noticed that this is a good way to earn superior income. Today, he is looking for a loan of $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to add new provisions and groceries to his existing stock. This Kiva loan will help him increase his revenue by 15%. In the future, he plans to open his own supermarket.

loans.use: to add new provisions and groceries to his existing stock.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He really cares for his children’s future and tries his best to offer them a suitable one. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2006. 

Today, he needs to borrow $2600 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children's school fees. He believes that education will help them achieve higher positions. In the future, he plans to take out more Kiva loans and cover their educational fees until graduation.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. Rose has a business selling local brew.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  

Rose sells her products from home, retail. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin.    The main business challenges for    Rose include transportation and seasonality.   Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale and also to educate her children up to university. 

Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills   and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He believes that combining forces with his wife will be great to develop their way of living. He has been working as a taxi driver for nine years. He’s accurate and honest and that makes his customers loyal to him. 

Today, he’s looking to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his car mechanic's fees. This will help him carry on his work in a proper way and target a wider range of people. In the future, he plans to buy a minivan to transport more people.

loans.use: to pay his car mechanic's fees.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells bread and waakye (rice and beans cooked together), and she serves the waakye with meat, fish, and egg stew.  She has been selling bread and waakye for three years now. 

Ama is married to a farmer and has four children.  She uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills and accommodation bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye.  With the new profit, Ama wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret cooks "banku" (fermented maize dough) for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Adum Banso near Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and has seven dependents.  

Margeret  has done this for 10 years.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her "banku" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall for the sale of her cooked "banku" and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her "banku" for sale.

loans.name: Alusine D.

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Alusine, a secondary school teacher in Makeni. The thirty-six-year-old Alusine has served in the teaching profession for three years now. 

In addition to his teaching profession, Alusine is also a small-scale trader. He has been a trader for ten years now. Currently, he sells rice and other locally produced foodstuffs.  Married with three children attending school, Alusine has requested a loan in order to invest it in his business. He will buy bags of rice for resale. Gradually, he will use his monthly salary to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice for resale.

loans.name: Veronica Isatu

texts.en:
Pictured above is Veronica, a secondary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. The thirty-three-year-old has served in the teaching profession for eleven years now. Veronica is married to a teacher and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. 

Veronica has requested a loan in order to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a house. At the end of each month, she will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат жительница города Исфары. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее смешанный ассортимент товара. В торговле ей помогает ее сын. Она берет кредит для покупки парфюмерии.
texts.en: Saodat is a married 39-year-old woman with three children.  She lives in Isfara and is engaged in sales in the market.  Saodat sells general merchandise. Her son helps her.  Saodat is taking out a loan to buy perfumery products.

loans.use: to buy perfumery products

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 20-year-old lady from Lambwe town situated in western Kenya. She is married to Charles and they have a one-year-old child.

Lilian operates a shoe-selling business in Lambwe town, a business she has done for the last two years making a monthly income of KES 2,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of men's and women's shoes for sale. Lilian will use her profits to add to her stock of shoes.  Her dream is to improve her standard of living and also to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en: Ihab is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child, who is still studying. He is the one taking care of his family and looking to offer them a fair standard of living. He has been working for the past two years by renting transportation buses on a freelance basis. He’s an expert at his job and well known by his customers. Today, he needs to borrow $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his daughter's school fees. In that way, she will be able to carry on her education in a proper way. In the future, he plans to develop his job and better support his family.

loans.use: To pay his daughter's school fees

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 50 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 28.  In 1996, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores called "pasal" are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical "pasal" might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Hassan, a secondary school teacher in Makeni. The thirty-three-year-old Hassan was born in Mateboi town in northern Sierra Leone. Hassan is single with one child who is in secondary school.

Hassan is pursuing further studies in university.  He has thus requested for this loan in order to pay his college fees. At the end of each month, he will use his monthly salary to repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina de 38 años de edad, esta casada con Francisco de 39 años de edad; viven en su casa propia junto a sus 02 queridos hijos, Alexander de 16 años y Heidy de 01 año; a quienes brindan lo mejor y desean un buen futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Justina ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella siembra plantas de cacao y café, productos que una vez cosechados los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus productos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante éste negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos. En su faena rutinaria cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja quien es su brazo derecho. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente alegre por la colaboración de los financistas ya que así podrá seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, realizará el mantenimiento de sus cultivos; comprará varios sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y volverlas productivas con el transcurso del tiempo.
texts.en:
38-year-old Justina is married to 39-year-old Francisco. They live together in their own house with their two lovely children,16-year-old Alexander and 1-year-old Heidy. They give them the best and hope for a good future for them. With a lot of effort, Justina has managed to work their land and make it very productive. She plants coffee and cacao, products that, once harvested, she takes to sell in the city of San Francisco, where she sells them wholesale. Her products have given her the necessary means to keep going and help with household expenses, and that is why she wants to put all her hope in getting this business off the ground.  

What she likes most about her work is taking care of the crops, since she feels very happy doing so. She has been doing this for 15 years and thinks the most difficult part of the job is transporting her products. In her daily work, she has the unconditional support of her husband, who is her right hand man. In the future she hopes to purchase new land to increase her crops. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is happy for the help of the financiers, since this allows her to continue with her work plans. With the 1,000 nuevos soles she will maintain her crops; she will buy several bags of fertilizer to fertilizer her land and make them productive again with the passing of time.

loans.use: to purchase several bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama sells plastic bowls, baskets, saucepans, banku (cooked fermented corn/cassava dough) and fish in Adum Benso. Mama has completed Junior High School (J.H.S.), and she is married with three children. Her husband is a small-scale miner.  

Mama has been selling plastics for the past five years. She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls and baskets to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop to sell her plastic containers.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls and baskets to sell.
